Maladies Treated: 由白内障引起的视力模糊
Chinese.Preparation: 15 to 30 g
Chinese.Contraindications: 在脾虚情况下谨慎使用；尤其是在胃内缺乏盐酸时不应使用。
Chinese.Research: 提取物对金黄色葡萄球菌、大肠杆菌和铜绿假单胞菌在体外具有强抑制作用。贝壳内层的水提取物可以保护被四氯化碳中毒的实验小鼠的肝脏。
Chemical Ingredients: 氨基酸（天冬氨酸、苏氨酸、丝氨酸、谷氨酸）

English.Preparation: 15 to 30 g
English.Contraindications: Use with caution in cases of spleen deficiency; especially when lack of hydrochloric acid in the stomach should not be using it.
English.Research: The extract possesses strong inhibiting effects on Staphylococcus aureus, E. coli, and Pseudomonas aeruginosa in vitro. The water extract of the inner layer of the shell can protect the liver in laboratory mice poisoned by carbon tetrachloride.
Chemical Ingredients: Amino acids (aspartic acid, threonine, serine, glutamic acid)

Chinese.Preparation: 用于汤和煎剂；标准剂量约为30-50克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕期或哺乳期应避免使用；长期使用可能对肝脏有毒；高剂量可能导致恶心和头晕。
Chinese.Research: 抗癌特性；对改善静脉功能不全和微血管病有效；改善记忆；可能控制焦虑；具有神经保护作用。
Chinese.Notes: 瘢痕组织内过多的胶原蛋白可能导致胶原瘤。

English.Preparation: Used in soups and decoctions; standard dosage is about 30-50g.
English.Contraindications: Should not be used during pregnancy or breastfeeding; long-term use may be toxic to the liver; high doses can cause nausea and dizziness.
English.Research: Anti-cancer properties; effective in improving venous insufficiency and microangiopathy; improves memory; may control anxiety; has neuroprotective effects.
English.Notes: Too much collagen inside scar tissues may lead to collagenoma.

Chinese.Preparation: 每天 6~15 克
Chinese.Contraindications: 在有瘡癌、胃虛伴隨腹瀉和已經成熟(破裂)的潰瘍情況下使用需謹慎
Chinese.Research: 廣譜抗生素效應、退燒、抗炎、保護肝臟、止嘔、促進血液循環、促進排尿。現代應用包括抗微生物和抗寄生蟲作用。

English.Preparation: 6~15 g per day
English.Contraindications: Use caution in cases of pixu and weixu with diarrhea and sores that are already ripened (broken)
English.Research: Broad spectrum antibiotic effect, lower fever, anti-inflammation, protect liver, stop vomiting, help blood circulation, promote urination. Modern applications include antimicrobial and antiparasitic effects.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂用量：10至15克。可制成丸剂或粉末形式。可通过煎煮和蒸发制成膏剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在有湿痰和气滞的胃病症中不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 在各种动物研究中，小剂量的玉竹煎剂或酊剂可强化心脏，而大剂量则会减弱心率。它影响血管、血压，并可能影响血脂和血糖水平。
Chinese.Notes: 对于治疗建议，指出与茶碱和氢氯噻嗪合用以治疗心脏疲劳，与山楂合用以治疗高脂血症。

English.Preparation: For decoction: 10 to 15 g. Can be used in pill or powder form. Can be made into paste by decocting and evaporating.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of damp phlegm and qi stagnation in the stomach.
English.Research: In various animal studies, small amounts of yu zhu decoction or tincture strengthen the heart, while large amounts weaken heart rate. It affects blood vessels, blood pressure, and can influence blood lipids and sugar levels.
English.Notes: For treatment recommendations, it is noted to use with Aminophylline and hydrochlorothiazide for cardiac exhaustion, and with shan zha for high lipids.

Chinese.Preparation: 果实用作健胃药、镇静剂、泻药和春药。根部和汁液用于炎症反应。从花序燃烧中获得的灰烬用作抗酸剂，治疗胆汁热、脾肿胀和胃灼热。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在广东、香港、新加坡、马来西亚和印度尼西亚，糖棕果实被称为非洲海椰子。这些是来自不同棕榈树的不同果实，不能互相替代用于药用。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，Borassus flabellifer Linn 的提取物具有抗氧化和细胞毒性潜力。
Chemical Ingredients: 维生素 B 复合体

English.Preparation: The fruits are used as a stomachic, sedative, laxative, and aphrodisiac. The roots and juice are used for inflammatory reactions. The ash obtained from burning the inflorescence is used as an antacid and to treat bilious fever, splenomegaly, and heart burn.
English.Contraindications: In Guangdong, Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia, and Indonesia, sugar palm fruit is sold as African sea coconuts. These are different fruits from different palm trees and are not interchangeable for medicinal use.
English.Research: Research indicates that the extract of Borassus flabellifer Linn has antioxidant and cytotoxicity potential.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量为 0.5 至 2 克，可用作煎剂。
Geography: 亚洲热带和亚热带地区
Chinese.Contraindications: 气虚或脾虚伴有腹泻，或妊娠期间不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 在台湾销售的冬葵子主要是苘麻 (Abutilon theophrasti Medic) 的种子。
Chinese.Notes: 冬葵子和苘麻的功能不同，不应互换。商业产品主要来自苘麻子。

English.Preparation: Dosage is 0.5 to 2 g, can be used as decoction.
Geography: Tropical and subtropical areas of Asia
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in cases of qi deficiency or spleen deficiency with loose stools or during pregnancies.
English.Research: The herb sold as dong kui zi in Taiwan is mainly the seed of qing ma (Abutilon theophrasti Medic).
English.Notes: The functions of dong kui zi and qing ma are different and should not be interchanged. The commercial product is mainly from qing ma zi.

Chinese.Preparation: 對於遺尿，使用60克補骨脂和益智仁，與鹽炒熟，磨成細粉，製作成6包，每次在粥中加入一包。早上服用1包；成人劑量加倍。對於白癜風，每隔一天在受影響的區域塗抹補骨脂提取物膏。每日劑量：每日10到20克；冷凍乾燥提取物：每日0.5到2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 有陰虛內熱症狀時不應使用。一些傳統來源提到它會對甘草產生拮抗作用。大劑量可能對腎臟有毒，並可能導致小鼠肝臟和睪丸萎縮。對於大劑量和/或長期使用應謹慎對待。
Chinese.Research: 現代研究表明，補骨脂具有抗菌作用，改善血液循環，並能提高白血球數量。然而，在大劑量下可能也會有一定的毒性。
Chinese.Notes: 補骨脂傳統上用於補腎陽，並因其在促進化療後白血球恢復等臨床應用中頗受歡迎。

English.Preparation: For enuresis, use 60 g of bu gu zhi and yi zhi ren, stir fry with salt, grind into fine powder, make into 6 packages, and add one bag to rice porridge. Take 1 in the morning; double the dosage for adults. For leukoderma, apply bu gu zhi extract paste every other day on affected areas. Daily dosage: 10 to 20 g per day; freeze-dried extract: 0.5 to 2 g per day.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in case of high heat due to yinxu condition. Some traditional sources mention that it antagonizes gan cao. Large dosages can be toxic to kidneys and may cause atrophy of the liver and testes in mice. Caution is advised for large dosages and/or long-term usage.
English.Research: Modern studies indicate that bu gu zhi has antibacterial effects, improves blood circulation, and can elevate white blood cell counts. However, it may also have some toxicity at large dosages.
English.Notes: Bu gu zhi is traditionally used to tonify kidney yang and has gained popularity for various clinical applications such as aiding in the recovery from white cell reduction due to chemotherapy.

Chinese.Preparation: 内服可作为颗粒或粉末服用，0.5-1钱（大约1.5-3克）。外用则研磨成细粉后涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 口服时需谨慎。阴虚火旺者不宜口服。这是一种临时药物，不宜长期使用。
Chinese.Research: 硼砂显示出微弱的碱性和抑制微生物的效果，对抑制包括大肠杆菌和金黄色葡萄球菌在内的多种细菌有效。
Chinese.Notes: 临床应用包括治疗癫痫和膝关节扭伤的情况，针对不同情况给出了具体剂量。

English.Preparation: For internal use, it can be taken as granules or powder, 0.5-1 qian (approximately 1.5-3 grams). For external use, grind into fine powder and apply.
English.Contraindications: Use with care if taken orally. Those with yin deficiency with fire should not take it orally. This is a temporary medicine, not to be used for long-term.
English.Research: Borax has shown weak alkaline properties and a micro-organism inhibition effect, being effective in inhibiting various bacteria including E. coli and Staphylococcus aureus.
English.Notes: Clinical application includes treatment for conditions such as epilepsy and knee sprains, with specific dosages outlined for various conditions.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量为9~15克。用水煮沸后作为茶饮用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 牲畜服用可导致瘫痪、运动障碍及其他中毒症状。
Chinese.Research: 用煎剂对多种细菌显示出抗菌作用，在小鼠中观察到利尿作用，其他对呼吸道疾病的治疗效果也有所记录。
Chinese.Notes: 草药的长期储存可能使其失效。局部应用可帮助治疗创伤。
Chemical Ingredients: 苄基-2,6-二甲氧基苯甲酸酯

English.Preparation: Daily dosage is 9~15 g. Boil with water and use as tea.
English.Contraindications: Consuming by livestock can lead to paralysis and movement disorders and other symptoms of poisoning.
English.Research: Antibacterial effect using decoction shown in vitro against various bacteria, diuretic effect observed in mice, other therapeutic effects noted for respiratory conditions.
English.Notes: Prolonged storage of the herb can render it ineffective. Topical application can help treatment of trauma.

Maladies Treated: 因功能低下导致的消化不良
胸部、腹部和胀气区的腹胀
Chinese.Preparation: 通常剂量为3到10克。大剂量可达15克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 气虚、脾胃虚弱（消化能力差）、前列腺增大或怀孕期间不得使用。
Chinese.Research: 辛弗林可以刺激β1、β2、β3、α1受体并增加血压。
Chinese.Notes: 使用前最好将药材浸泡在水中并彻底清洗。

Maladies Treated: Bloating in chest, abdomen and solar plexus area
Prolapse of stomach, uterus and rectum
English.Preparation: Usual dosage is 3 to 10 g. Large dosage can be up to 15 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in case of qi deficiency, spleen and stomach deficiency (weak digestion), enlarged prostate, or during pregnancy.
English.Research: Synephrine can stimulate b1, b2, b3, a1 receptors and increase blood pressure.
English.Notes: It is better to soak the herb in water and wash it thoroughly before use.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量为10-15克。可以单独使用或与其他成分结合，根据不同病症指示使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 大量吸入这种细粉尘可能导致肺水肿和上呼吸道刺激，并可能引起喉咙发痒咳嗽。摄入大量剂量可能引起胃部刺激、恶心和腹泻。它可以刺激结肠和阴道内肉芽肿的生长。皮肤接触可能引起过敏反应。对于脾虚、高热或怀孕期间不宜使用。

English.Preparation: Daily dosage of 10-15 g. Can be used alone or combined with other ingredients as indicated for different conditions.
English.Contraindications: Inhalation of large amounts of this fine dust may lead to pulmonary edema and irritation to the upper respiratory tract and can result in tickling cough. Ingesting large doses may cause gastric irritation, nausea, and diarrhea. It can stimulate the growth of granulomas in the colon and vagina. Skin contact may cause allergic reaction. Do not use in case of pixu (spleen deficient), high fever, or during pregnancy.

Chinese.Preparation: 6到15克或3到5瓣，大蒜煎剂。对于哮喘，民间配方包括用冰糖蒸大蒜并取其汁液。对于百日咳，将大蒜捣碎与水和糖调味。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚、产后不久、麻疹、疖肿、腹泻或眼部感染时不可使用。长时间大剂量使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，大蒜具有多种健康益处，包括降低血脂和血糖、对细菌和真菌的抗生素效应，以及对心血管健康的积极影响。
Chinese.Notes: 大蒜的抗癌特性及增强免疫功能的能力已被研究。它可以抑制某些有害细菌，并在民间医学中使用。

English.Preparation: 6 to 15 g or 3 to 5 cloves in decoction. For asthma, a folk formula involves steaming garlic with rock sugar and taking the juice. For whooping cough, smash garlic and mix with water and sugar to taste.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in cases of yin deficiency, shortly after childbirth, measles, boils, during diarrhea, or eye infections. Long-term use in large doses can be toxic to kidneys.
English.Research: Studies show garlic has various health benefits including lowering blood lipids and blood sugar, antibiotic effects against bacteria and fungi, and positive impacts on cardiovascular health.
English.Notes: Garlic has been researched for its anti-cancer properties and its ability to enhance immune function. It can suppress certain harmful bacteria and has been used in folk medicine.
Chemical Ingredients: Vitamins A, B, C, D, E, F

Maladies Treated: 因消化不良引起的腹泻
Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂用量：3到10克内服入煎剂，常用量3∼10克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚火旺者忌服。
Chinese.Research: 刺激胃壁神经，改善消化功能，抗菌作用，延长血细胞凝固时间，抗炎，治疗后认知增强。

Maladies Treated: Cold and pain in the stomach
Vomiting due to coldness in stomach
English.Preparation: For concoction: 3 to 10 g内服入煎剂，常用量3∼10克。
English.Contraindications: Do not use in case of yinxu with heat. 陰虚火旺者忌服。
English.Research: Stimulates the nerves in the wall of stomach, improves digestive function, anti-bacterial properties, prolongs blood cell coagulation time, anti-inflammation, cognitive enhancement after treatment.

Chinese.Preparation: 9-15克，水煎服用。外用适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: [1] 中华本草; [2] 河南中草药手册

English.Preparation: 9-15 grams, decocted for oral use. Appropriate amount for external use.
English.Contraindications: [1] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草; [2] Henan Chinese Herb Handbook 河南中草藥手冊

Botanical: 西伯利亚苍耳 Patr. ex Widd.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：3到9克。外用：适量使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 大剂量有毒。轻度病例的临床症状包括无力、食欲不振、恶心、呕吐、腹痛、腹泻或便秘。严重病例可能导致昏迷、抽搐、休克和死亡。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明在高剂量下有毒性及相关风险。
Chinese.Notes: 苍耳子在传统医学中用于呼吸系统问题。

English.Preparation: In decoction: 3 to 9 g. External Application: use appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: Large dosage is toxic. In mild cases, clinical symptoms include lack of strength, lack of appetite, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea or constipation. Serious cases may lead to coma, spasm, shock, and death.
English.Research: Modern research indicates toxicity at high dosages and associated risks.
English.Notes: Cang er zi is used in traditional medicine, particularly for respiratory issues.

Chinese.Preparation: 0.3克至1克粉末形式，内服。
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕期间不宜使用。
Chinese.Notes: 其功能类似于麝香。少量可以兴奋中枢神经系统；大量可以抑制中枢神经系统并有降低血压的效果。

English.Preparation: 0.3 g ~ 1 g in powder form, taken internally.
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancy.
English.Notes: Its function is similar to she xiang. A small amount can excite the central nervous system; a large amount can inhibit CNS and have the effect of dropping blood pressure.

Maladies Treated: 大量或持续性非经期阴道出血
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕期间或有近期溃疡病史的患者不适用。
Chinese.Research: 毒性与注意事项：怀孕期间或有近期溃疡病史的患者不适用。
Chinese.Notes: 何义等使用黄岚丸（黄芪、贯众、板蓝根各30克）治疗21例CMV-IgM阳性的女性。在一个治疗周期中，89.47%转为阴性。

Maladies Treated: Massive or incessant extramenstrual vaginal bleeding
English.Preparation: 4.5 to 9 g
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancies or in patients with recent history of ulcers.
English.Research: Toxicity & Cautions: not to use during pregnancies or in patients with recent history of ulcers.
English.Notes: He yi et al. used Huang Lan Pills (huang qi, guan zhong, ban lan gen 30 g each) treated 21 cases of CMV-IgM positive women. In one treatment cycle, 89.47% became negative.

Chinese.Preparation: 用于治疗因泌尿道结石导致的疼痛：使用大小如枣的桃胶，与300毫升饮用水混合，每天服用三次。用于治疗糖尿病：用温水洗净桃胶，置于小锅中煮。可以根据需要添加调味品，但不要添加糖。每次口服30至60克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阿拉伯胶被错误地标称为桃胶或桃安珠（珠状）或桃胶粉（粉末形式）。阿拉伯胶并不是一种纯化学化合物。
Chinese.Research: 毒性与注意事项：从古至今的有效方剂。
Chinese.Notes: 桃树、梅树、杏树、樱桃树的树干分泌物称为桃胶（桃胶）。

English.Preparation: For treatment of pain caused by stone in urinary tract: Use tao jiao the size of dai zao and mix with 300 cc of drinking water. Take 3 times a day. For treatment of diabetes: wash tao jiao with luke warm water. Cook in a small pot. Add any flavoring if desired but do not add sugar. Take orally 30 to 60 grams each time.
English.Contraindications: Gum arabic are being sold as tao jiao or tao an zhu (beads shape) or tao jiao powder (in powder form) which is incorrect. Gum arabic is not a pure chemical compound.
English.Research: Toxicity & Cautions: Effective formulae from Ancient Time to Today.
English.Notes: The secretion of trunks of peach trees, plum trees, apricot trees, cherry trees are called tao jiao (peach resin).

Maladies Treated: 潮濕且有異味的腹股溝區域
Chinese.Preparation: 每日可服用3到12克的草藥。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在脾虛、消化力弱或食欲不振的情況下不要使用。在沒有真正熱的情況下應該小心使用。
Chinese.Research: 現代研究結果將會被加載。

English.Preparation: 3 to 12 g of the herb may be taken daily.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of spleen deficiency, weak digestion, or lack of appetite. Use caution when there is no real heat.
English.Research: Modern research findings are to be loaded.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量：9 - 15克。用于治疗小腿腓肠肌痉挛：组成：木瓜、白芍、甘草。煎成汤剂，作为茶饮用。用于治疗肌肉疼痛和肌肉萎缩：组成：紫菊皮75克（用米酒炒制），当归18.75克，川牛膝11.25克，羌活7.5克，木瓜11.25克。使用3公斤优质米酒。采用双重烹饪，煮约一个小时。使用前放置过夜作为饮用酒。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在感冒或流感情况下不宜使用。过量使用可能损害牙齿和骨骼。长期过量使用木瓜可能会损伤牙齿和骨骼。
Chinese.Research: 首次从木瓜属中分离出化合物4-7。
Chinese.Notes: 草药'木瓜'与作为水果食用的木瓜不同，后者是植物木瓜（Carica papaya）的果实。美国政府出版的一本书错误地将木瓜列为木瓜（Carica papaya）的果实。

Maladies Treated: Pain in loin and knee joints
Lack of strength in legs and knees
Prevent cirrhosis of liver resulting in ascites
English.Preparation: Daily dosage: 9 - 15 g. For treatment of spasm of gastrocnemius muscle (calf): Composition: mu gua, bai shao, gan cao. Make into decoction and use as tea. For treatment of muscle pain and muscle atrophy: Composition: zi jing pi 75 g (stir fry with rice wine), dang gui 18.75 g, chuan niu xi 11.25 g, qiang huo 7.5 g, mu gua 11.25 g. Use 3 kilograms of good quality rice wine. Use double cook and cook for about an hour. Leave it overnight before using as drinking wine.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of cold or influenza. Excessive use may harm the teeth and bones. Long-term excessive use of mu gua may damage the teeth and bones.
English.Research: Compounds 4-7 are isolated from the Chaenomeles genus for the first time.
English.Notes: The herb 'mu gua' is not the same as mu gua eaten as fruit, which is the fruit of the plant Carica papaya. A book published by the U.S. government incorrectly lists mu gua as fruit of Carica papaya.

Chinese.Preparation: 麻黄应煮水以制成草药茶。正常剂量范围从2.5克到6克，大剂量可达15克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 有心脏问题、高血压、前列腺炎或缺乏葡萄糖-6-磷酸脱氢酶的患者不应使用。气或脾虚伴有水肿的情况下不建议使用。长期使用可能导致严重的肝脏问题。
Chinese.Research: L-麻黄碱已被发现可增加心输出量，但可能导致心律不齐和其他不良反应。由于安全性问题，FDA禁止含有麻黄的膳食补充剂。
Chinese.Notes: 传统上不用于饮食配方或作为娱乐药物。由于潜在危险，建议对未经训练的使用者保持警惕。

English.Preparation: Ma huang should be boiled in water to make an herbal tea. Normal dosage ranges from 2.5 g to 6 g, with large amounts up to 15 g.
English.Contraindications: Should not be used by patients with heart problems, hypertension, prostatitis, or those with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency. Not advisable in cases of qi or spleen deficiency with edema. Long-term use can lead to serious liver problems.
English.Research: L-ephedrine has been found to increase cardiac output but can cause arrhythmia and other adverse effects. The FDA banned dietary supplements containing ephedra due to safety concerns.
English.Notes: Traditionally not used in diet formulas or as a recreational drug. Cautions advised against untrained usage due to potential dangers.

Chinese.Preparation: 蜂胶可以以非酒精形式高浓度食用，如软胶囊或浓缩液体。特定肝病患者应避免使用含酒精的蜂胶产品。
Chinese.Contraindications: 没有观察到副作用；然而，肝病患者应避免含酒精的蜂胶产品。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，蜂胶与抗生素联合使用对金黄色葡萄球菌产生协同作用，并抑制几种链球菌的生长。它还具有调节血糖的效果，并能保护肝炎B。
Chinese.Notes: 蜂胶含有多种活性化合物，包括黄酮和酸，这些成分有助于其治疗特性。已知它能增强组织修复，是一种强效抗氧化剂。

English.Preparation: Propolis can be consumed in high concentrations in non-alcoholic forms such as soft capsules or concentrated fluids. Alcoholic products should be avoided by patients with specific liver diseases.
English.Contraindications: No side effects have been noted; however, patients with liver diseases should avoid alcoholic propolis products.
English.Research: Research indicates that propolis exhibits a synergistic effect with antibiotics against Staphylococcus aureus and inhibits the growth of several streptococcal species. It also has blood glucose modulation effects and protects against hepatitis B.
English.Notes: Propolis contains various active compounds including flavonoids and acids that contribute to its therapeutic properties. It is known to enhance tissue repair and is considered a strong antioxidant.

Botanical: 细毛淡竹 Brongn. Var. elatum Hack.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日9 ~ 18克；用水煮沸制成茶。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适用于阳虚患者或妊娠期间使用。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究待更新。

Botanical: Lophatherum gracile Brongn. Var. elatum Hack.

Maladies Treated: Inability to sleep due to heat irritation
English.Preparation: 9 ~ 18 g per day; boil with water to make tea for formula
English.Contraindications: Do not use in patients with yangxu (yang deficient) or during pregnancy.
English.Research: Modern research to be loaded.

Chinese.Preparation: 制成 decoction 供口服：9-15克，或在沸水中泡制。
Chinese.Contraindications: 由于此草药的利尿作用，肾功能较弱者应避免频繁使用。它还含有大量的有机酸；胃酸过多者应避免使用。
Chinese.Research: 该草药中的多酚提取物可以减轻1型糖尿病的肾病。在2型糖尿病患者中，观察到胆固醇水平显著降低，同时高密度脂蛋白胆固醇增加。其提取物在对抗动脉粥样硬化、肝病、癌症、糖尿病及其他代谢综合征方面显示出活性。
Chinese.Notes: 花萼中含有洛神酸，干萼中约占15%，以及各种花青素。

English.Preparation: Make into decoction for oral consumption: 9-15 g, or brew in boiling water.
English.Contraindications: Due to the diuretic effect of the herb, those with weak kidney function should not use too often. It also contains a large amount of organic acid; those with too much stomach acid should avoid using it.
English.Research: Polyphenol extracts from this herb can attenuate nephropathy in type 1 diabetes. In patients with type II diabetes, significant decreases in cholesterol levels were observed, alongside increases in HDL cholesterol. Its extracts exhibit activities against atherosclerosis, liver disease, cancer, diabetes, and other metabolic syndromes.
English.Notes: The flower calyx contains hibiscus acid, about 15% in dry calyx, and various anthocyanins.

Maladies Treated: 暂时缓解偶尔影响能量、消化、神经和情绪的压力
Chinese.Preparation: 癌症治疗：配方1使用120克全草（去掉根部）与500毫升水煮至剩200毫升，与大米和大枣粥混合。每日服用1至2个月。配方2使用60克与500毫升水慢煮至剩300毫升，早晚各服用7至10天。
Chinese.Contraindications: 可能引起恶心和呕吐。
Chinese.Research: 水提取物对乙型肝炎病毒的抑制作用。
Chinese.Notes: 用于各种出血状况，并作为癌症治疗的潜在药物。

Maladies Treated: Temporary relief of occasional stress affecting energy, digestion, nerves and emotions
English.Preparation: For cancer treatment: Formula 1 uses 120 g of whole plant (except the roots) boiled with 500 c.c. of water until 200 c.c. remains, mixed with porridge made from rice and da zao. Take daily for 1 to 2 months. Formula 2 uses 60 g simmered with 500 ml water until 300 ml remains, taken orally morning and night for 7 to 10 days.
English.Contraindications: May cause nausea and vomiting.
English.Research: Inhibition of hepatitis B virus by an aqueous extract of this herb.
English.Notes: Used for various bleeding conditions and as a potential treatment in cancer therapy.

Maladies Treated: 因肾阳虚而导致的痰中带血
Chinese.Preparation: 每日4.5至12克。用水煮沸制备成剂量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 大剂量和/或长期使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Research: 研究显示它改善免疫功能，保护肾脏和肝脏免受毒素侵害，对心律有积极影响，并减少慢性肾病中的肾功能下降。
Chinese.Notes: 最佳质量产自四川。目前大多数来自西藏和青海。购买时要谨慎选择优质草药。

Maladies Treated: Over abundance of mucus and tears
Blood in phlegm from kidney yang deficiency
English.Preparation: 4.5 to 12 g per day. Prepare by boiling with water to make into servings.
English.Contraindications: Large dosages and/or long term usage can be toxic to kidneys.
English.Research: Studies show it improves immune functions, protects kidneys and liver from toxins, and has positive effects on heart rhythm and reduces renal function decline in chronic kidney disease.
English.Notes: Best quality produced in Sichuan. Most available today comes from Tibet and Qinghai. Be cautious of purchasing quality herbs.

Chinese.Preparation: 建议剂量为每日3-5克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 如果对菊科植物如紫菀、菊花、艾草、豚草和牛蒡过敏，或使用血液稀释剂如华法林，请谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，这种草药可能具有解痉、抗焦虑、抗炎和降低胆固醇的特性等。
Chinese.Notes: 这种草药展现出抑制吗啡依赖和抗氧化特性等效果。

English.Preparation: Recommended dosage is 3-5 g daily.
Geography: northern and western parts of Xinjiang
English.Contraindications: Use with care if allergic to Asteraceae family plants such as aster, chrysanthemum, mugwort, ragweed, and ragwort, or if using blood thinners like warfarin.
English.Research: Research shows this herb may have antispasmodic, anxiolytic, anti-inflammatory, and cholesterol-lowering properties, among others.
English.Notes: This herb exhibits effects such as inhibition of morphine dependence and antioxidant properties.

Chinese.Preparation: 5到10克。使用前炒沙。用500毫升水煎煮，收煎至200毫升。制作成一天的剂量，分为3次服用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕期间不宜使用。缺乏和已经成熟和溃烂的疮病患者使用时需谨慎。市场上销售的大部分草药是假冒的，用塑料制成。

Maladies Treated: pain in the joints of lower limbs
English.Preparation: 5 to 10 g. Stir fry in sand before use. Decoction with 500 cc of water. Simmer till 200 cc. Make into one day dose. Make into 3 servings.
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancy. Use with caution in cases of deficiency and sores that have been ripen and ulcerated. Most of the herb sold is fake and made with plastic.

Maladies Treated: 伴有眩暈和耳鳴的高血壓
Chinese.Preparation: 龍膽草的煎劑每日可服用0.3到3克，可以煎煮或粉末形式。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不宜在因脾虛而引起的腹瀉時使用。小心不要使用桂九，這是一種用於癌症治療的毒草。
Chinese.Research: 龍膽草的煎劑抑制假單胞菌、變形桿菌、傷寒沙門氏菌、金黃色葡萄球菌、某些皮膚真菌及鈍行性病原菌。具有抗炎、鎮靜和肌肉鬆弛的效果。餐前半小時服用少量可刺激消化系統，促進消化酶的分泌。高劑量可能干擾消化，並可能引起頭痛和眩暈。
Chinese.Notes: 配方樣本包括促進胃腸強化的混合物。重要的是要避免與桂九混淆，因為它在外觀上與龍膽草相似。

Maladies Treated: Red swollen sore throat and eyes
Swollen and painful ears or sudden loss of hearing
English.Preparation: Decoction of long dan cao can be taken in the amount of 0.3 to 3 g per day as decoction or powder form.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in case of diarrhea due to spleen deficiency. Be careful not to use gui jiu, which is a poisonous herb for cancer treatment.
English.Research: Decoction of long dan cao inhibits Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Proteus species, Salmonella typhi, Staphylococcus aureus, certain skin fungi, and Leptospirosis. Has anti-inflammatory, sedative, and muscle relaxing effects. Small amounts taken half an hour before meals stimulate the digestive system and promote the secretion of digestive enzymes. High doses can interfere with digestion and may cause headaches and dizziness.
English.Notes: Samples of formulae include gastrointestinal strengthening blends. It is important to avoid confusion with gui jiu, which bears physical similarities to long dan cao.

Chinese.Contraindications: 过量使用可能导致轻微腹泻。
Chinese.Research: 蒲公英的煎剂可以增强甲氧苄啶（TMP）的效果。理想的组合是蒲公英2.5克（生药）：TMP 10毫克。塔拉沙草显示它可以帮助防止骨质疏松，特别是对更年期女性。

Maladies Treated: Lung cancer with coughing blood and pus
English.Contraindications: Overdose can cause mild diarrhea.
English.Research: The decoction of pu gong ying can enhance the effect of trimethoprimum (TMP). The ideal combination is pu gong ying 2.5 g (raw herb): TMP 10 mg. Taraxacum formosanum shows that it can help prevent osteoporosis especially for menopausal women.

Chinese.Preparation: 3至9克；或炒香种子。儿童每岁使用一粒。成人剂量：10至15粒。空腹服用。咀嚼后吞下。
Chinese.Contraindications: 服用大量剂量可能引起打嗝、头晕、无力、恶心，甚至呕吐和腹泻。与茶同服可能引起打嗝或腹泻。停止服用后症状会缓解。如果出现毒性反应，可以使用丁香汤作为解毒剂。
Chinese.Research: 使君子水提取物可以抑制某些皮肤真菌。
Chinese.Notes: 根据《本草纲目》，用热茶与此药同服会立即引起腹泻。

English.Preparation: 3 to 9 g; or stir fry to heat up seeds. For children use one seed for every year old. Adult dosage: 10 to 15 seeds. Take with empty stomach. Chew and swallow.
English.Contraindications: Taking large dosage may induce hiccups, dizziness, lack of energy, nausea, even vomiting, and diarrhea. Taking with tea may induce hiccups or diarrhea. Symptoms will subside once stop taking the herb. If it result in toxic reaction, cloves decoction can be used as antidote.
English.Research: shi jun zi water extract can inhibit certain skin fungi.
English.Notes: According to Ben Cao Gang Mu, using hot tea with this herb can cause diarrhea immediately.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：6至12克，或制成酒精提取物。外用：捣碎后涂抹于患处。
Chinese.Contraindications: 头痛、视物模糊伴血虚及内热或脾虚的情况下慎用。
Chinese.Research: 抗PMST毒性与注意事项。

Maladies Treated: Wind-heat with swollen and painful red eyes
English.Preparation: Decoction: 6 to 12 g, or make into alcohol extract. External application: smash and apply on affected parts.
English.Contraindications: Use with care in cases of headache, blurry vision with blood deficient and heat or in cases of pixu (spleen deficient).
English.Research: Anti PMSToxicity & Cautions.

Botanical: 家禽 Gallus gallus domesticus Brisson

Chinese.Preparation: 煎煮：3至10克。粉末形式：1.5至3克。其效果被認為優於煎煮。

English.Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 10 g. In Powder Form: 1.5 to 3 g. The effect is deemed to be better than that of decoction.

Chinese.Preparation: 仅供外用
Chinese.Contraindications: 哺乳期或怀孕期间不得使用。
Chinese.Research: 海伦纳林（Helenalin）是阿尔尼卡的活性成分，是一种抗炎的倍半萜内酯，选择性抑制转录因子NF-kappaB。

English.Preparation: External use only
English.Contraindications: Do not use during breastfeeding or during pregnancy.
English.Research: Helenalin, an active ingredient of Arnica, is an anti-inflammatory sesquiterpene lactone from Arnica, selectively inhibits transcription factor NF-kappaB.

Maladies Treated: 因感染引起的喉咙肿胀
因肺部感染引起的咳嗽
因病毒感染引起的肝炎
乙型肝炎表面抗原携带者
Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：6 - 10 克。外用：适量使用。对于较大的疣：取山豆根和板蓝根各60克，加3000毫升水，煮沸10分钟，冷却至洗脚水温度，浸泡30分钟，每天一次。
Chinese.Contraindications: 此药性寒且苦，可能导致植物神经系统过度兴奋。过量使用可引起消化系统紊乱、恶心、呕吐、食欲不振、胃痛、腹泻、胸口紧压感和心悸。脾虚患者须谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 在对大鼠的实验中显示，山豆根能够降低AST、总蛋白、白蛋白和胆固醇。

Maladies Treated: Swelling of throat due to infection
Cough due to infection of lungs
Warts of palms of the feet
English.Preparation: For decoction: 6 - 10 g. For external application: use appropriate amount. For larger warts: use 60 g each of shan dou gen and ban lan gen, add 3000 c.c. water, bring to boil for 10 minutes, cool to bath water temperature, soak feet for 30 minutes, once a day.
English.Contraindications: This herb is very cold and very bitter. It can cause over-excitement of the vegetative nervous system. Overdose can cause disorder of the digestive system, nausea, vomiting, lack of appetite, stomachache, diarrhea, tightness in the chest area, and palpitations. Use with care in cases of spleen deficiency.
English.Research: In lab tests on rats, it showed shan dou gen could lower AST, total protein, albumin, and cholesterol.
Chemical Ingredients: higher alcohol ester of caffeic acid

Botanical: Fritillaria unibracteata Hsiao et K. C. Hsiao
Fritillaria verticillata Willd. var. Fritillaria thunbergii Bak.

Maladies Treated: 因阴虚伴厚痰而致的热咳
Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂: 3至10克。粉剂（与水混合）: 1至2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 脾虚型寒湿痰咳的人不宜使用。生贝母有毒，不可内服。
Chinese.Research: 少量的皂苷可提高狗、猫和兔子的血压，而大量则可降低。注射7.5 ml/kg的贝母碱给兔子增加血糖，并维持超过2小时。它还具有抗生素效果。
Chinese.Notes: 常用于方剂如当归贝母苦参丸、桔梗白散、养肺汤。

Pharmaceutical: Chuan bei mu: Bulbus Fritillariae Cirrhosae
Zhe bei mu: Bulbus Fritillariae Thunbergii
Botanical: Fritillaria unibracteata Hsiao et K. C. Hsiao
Fritillaria verticillata Willd. var. Fritillaria thunbergii Bak.

Maladies Treated: Hot cough due to yinxu with thick phlegm
English.Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 10 g. As powder form (mixed in water): 1 to 2 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to use by those with pixu (spleen deficient) type of cold, with wet phlegm and cold cough. Raw bei mu is toxic and not for internal use.
English.Research: Small amount of the saponin can raise blood pressure of dogs, cats, and rabbits while a large amount can lower it. Injection of 7.5 ml/kg peimine to rabbits increased blood sugar and maintained it for more than 2 hours. It also has antibiotic effects.
English.Notes: Commonly used in formulas such as dang gui bei mu ku shen wan, jie geng bai san, yang fei tang.

Botanical: Perilla frutescens (L.) Britt. P. frutescens (L.) Britt. var. typica Makino

Maladies Treated: 鱼类或贝类引起的食物中毒
Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：5到10克。短暂煮沸。对于鱼或蟹引起的食物中毒：单独使用紫苏，最多30克。外用：捣碎并涂抹在受影响区域或用煎剂洗涤。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适用于发热病、气虚或外表虚弱的情况。使用前建议先将草药浸泡在水中并彻底清洗。
Chinese.Research: 已报告齐墩果酸和熊果酸具有抗炎活性。
Chinese.Notes: 由于可能存在农药残留，最好在使用前将草药浸泡和清洗。

Botanical: Perilla frutescens (L.) Britt. P. frutescens (L.) Britt. var. typica Makino

Maladies Treated: Food poisoning from fish or shellfish
English.Preparation: For decoction: 5 to 10 g. Boil briefly. For food poisoning from fish or crab: use single item of zi su of up to 30 g. External use: smash and apply to affected areas or wash with decoction.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of febrile diseases, qi deficient or weak exterior. It is recommended to soak the herb in water and wash it thoroughly before use.
English.Research: Oleanolic acid and ursolic acid were both reported to have anti-inflammatory activity.
English.Notes: It is better to soak and wash the herb before use due to potential farm chemical residues.

Chinese.Preparation: 5到10克煎服；1.5到3克，作粉剂服用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在血热和气虚的情况下，或在月经提前或怀孕期间不宜使用。长期使用可能对心脏和肾脏有毒。避免与氯丙嗪、中央神经系统兴奋剂、单胺氧化酶抑制剂、西药或麻千子同使用。
Chinese.Research: 在一项研究中，给予猴子最大剂量为110 mg/kg的dI-四氢巴马汀未观察到毒性反应，仅记录到镇静和催眠现象。
Chinese.Notes: 无

English.Preparation: 5 to 10 g in decoction; 1.5 to 3 g, taken as powder.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of heat in blood and qi deficiency, or during early arrival of menses or pregnancy. Long term usage can be toxic to the heart and kidneys. Avoid use with chlorpromazine hydrochloride, CNS stimulants, monoamine oxidase inhibitors, strychnine or ma qian zi.
English.Research: In a study, no toxic reactions were observed in monkeys given up to 110 mg/kg dI-tetrahydropalmatine, only sedation and hypnotic conditions were noted.
English.Notes: None

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：煎剂10~15克；鲜草：30 ~ 60克，或榨汁或研磨成粉。外用：适量使用。煎剂洗涤受影响区域或将鲜草捣成糊状涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 过量使用会损害消化。此草不适合脾虚、血虚、气虚者。
Chinese.Research: 对HBsAg和HBeAg具有抑制作用。

English.Preparation: Oral: make into decoction 10~15 g; fresh herb: 30 ~ 60 g, or make into juice or grind into powder. External application: use appropriate amount. Make into decoction and wash affected areas or smash fresh herb into paste and apply.
English.Contraindications: Overuse can damage digestion. This herb is not suitable for those with pixu (spleen deficient), xue xu (blood deficient), qixu (qi deficient).
English.Research: Inhibiting effect on HBsAg and HBeAg.

Chinese.Preparation: 每天10到15克，煎湯服用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在高濕氣伴隨脹滿/腹脹和慢性腹瀉的情況下不宜使用。一些女性在更年期後或某些男性不耐受長期使用或大劑量。過度煮煉可能因油分蒸發而減少效果。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，當歸對子宮有抑制和刺激作用，降低脂質，促進紅細胞生成，擴張冠狀動脈，改善循環。它顯示出一些抗癌效果，且副作用低。然而，頻繁攝入可能促進乳腺癌細胞的增殖。
Chinese.Notes: 當歸金油丸對治療哮喘有效，成人的劑量為每天三次150毫克。對高血壓及慢性血栓等多種疾病的患者顯示良好效果。

English.Preparation: 10 to 15 g per day in decoction.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in case of high dampness with fullness/flatulence and chronic diarrhea. Some women after menopause or some men do not tolerate long-term usage or large dosages. Overcooking may lessen effectiveness due to evaporating oil.
English.Research: Research has shown that dang gui can have both inhibiting and stimulating effects on the uterus, lowers lipids, promotes red cell production, dilates coronary arteries, and improves circulation. It has shown some anti-cancer effects with low side effects. However, frequent ingestion may promote the multiplication of breast cancer cells.
English.Notes: Dang gui jin you wan is effective in treating asthma, with a dosage of 150 mg three times a day for adults. It showed good results in patients with various ailments including hypertension and chronic thrombosis.

Chinese.Preparation: 10-30 克。需煮得比其他药材久。也可以使用粉末形式。
Chinese.Contraindications: 个别案例中有面部肿胀、血尿、尿液浑浊及泌尿道感染。
Chinese.Research: 焚烧外壳后，容易粉碎，主要成分碳酸钙氧化为氧化钙，可更好地中和胃酸。
Chinese.Notes: 烧过的瓦楞子用于中和胃酸，通常与乌贼骨一起使用。

English.Preparation: 10-30 g. To be boiled longer than other herbs. Can also be used in powder form.
English.Contraindications: In isolated cases there are swollen faces, hematuria, cloudy urine and infection of the urinary tract.
English.Research: After burning the shells, they are easier to smash and the main ingredient of calcium carbonate becomes oxidized into calcium oxide, which can neutralize peptic acid better than calcium carbonate.
English.Notes: Burnt wa leng zi is being used in neutralizing stomach acid. Usually it is combined with wu zei gu.

Chinese.Preparation: 用于水肿和腹水：使用醋处理过的芫花与雄黄，制成粉末内服。对于头癣或癣：与猪油混合外用。内服剂量为1.5克至3克煎剂或0.3克粉末，每天服用2次。外用：适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕妇禁用，与甘草相克。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明该草药具有毒性并需谨慎使用。
Chinese.Notes: 用于呕吐及导致的肋骨疼痛、哮喘或咳嗽。例方包括芫花、大蓟、大枣、甘遂。

English.Preparation: For edema and ascites: use vinegar processed yuan hua with xiong huang, make into powder and take internally. For head fungal or ringworm: mix with lard and apply topically. Dosage for internal use is 1.5 g to 3 g in decoction or 0.3 g in powder form, taken 2 times per day. External use: appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of pregnancies. It is incompatible with gan cao.
English.Research: Modern research indicates toxicity and cautions related to this herb.
English.Notes: Used for retching and resulting pain in rib cage, asthma, or cough. Example prescription includes yuan hua, da ji, da zao, gan sui.

Chinese.Preparation: 3到6克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚导致的遗精、尿失禁，月经期外阴道出血的情况下不宜使用。
Chemical Ingredients: Trans-1-(4-羟基-3-甲氧基苯基)-7-苯基-1-烯-3-酮

Maladies Treated: Pain in abdomen with cold feeling
English.Preparation: 3 to 6 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yin deficiency with resulting spermatorrhea, incontinence of urine, excessive bleeding in the vagina not during periods.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：4至12克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 气虚和阴虚引起的咳嗽禁用。出血或呕血病例需谨慎使用。长期使用可能会削弱身体功能。
Chinese.Research: 根据日本全国农业协会的说法，市场上出售的五种草药均经过测试，发现它们含有农药残留，陳皮的残留水平最高。
Chinese.Notes: 使用前最好将陳皮浸泡在水中并彻底清洗。

English.Preparation: Dosage: 4 to 12 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of cough due to qixu (qi deficient) and yinxu (yin deficient). Use care in cases of bleeding or vomiting blood. Long term usage may weaken the body function.
English.Research: According to the Whole Nation of Japan Farmers' Federation, the five kinds of herb being sold in the market have been tested and shown they contain farm chemical residues, with chen pi containing the highest levels.
English.Notes: It is better to soak chen pi in water and wash it thoroughly before use.

Chinese.Preparation: 内服：3到6克的煎剂；外用：适量用于洗剂。针对不同的病症，制成药膏或用草本制作汁液。
Chinese.Contraindications: 外感虚脱、出汗者禁用。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明具有利尿作用及对心血管系统的活性，尽管抗菌和抗疟效果的结果是阴性的。
Chinese.Notes: 燃烧此草药产生的烟雾可驱赶蚊虫，但气虚者应避免使用。

English.Preparation: For internal use: decoction of 3 to 6 g; For external use: appropriate amount in wash for rashes. For different conditions, prepare either a paste or juice from the herb.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in case of external deficient with instant sweating.
English.Research: Modern research indicates diuretic effects and activity on the cardiovascular system, although results on anti-bacteria and anti-malaria were negative.
English.Notes: Burning this herb produces smoke that can repel mosquitoes, but should be avoided by those with qi deficiency.

Chinese.Preparation: 推荐剂量为9到15克。生的懷牛膝有效于破血瘀。熟的懷牛膝有效于强筋健骨，利尿，增强身体精气。
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕期间不宜使用，脾虚造成的腹泻，过度月经或气虚造成的遗精不宜使用。不宜与百钱同用。
Chinese.Research: 该草药已被证明具有降血压、抗炎、镇痛、增强免疫、刺激子宫和抗衰老的效果。其多糖增强免疫系统并改善循环功能。
Chinese.Notes: 根和茎含有多种化学成分，包括牛膝多糖和蜕皮素。

Maladies Treated: Weakness and pain in loin and knees
Postpartum pain in abdomen due to blood stasis
English.Preparation: Recommended dosage is 9 to 15 grams. Raw huai niu xi is effective for breaking blood stasis. Cooked huai niu xi is effective for strengthening muscles and bones, promoting urination and strengthening essence of the body.
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancy, diarrhea due to spleen deficiency, excessive menstruation or spermatorrhea due to qi deficiency. Not to use with bai qian.
English.Research: The herb has been shown to possess anti-hypertensive, anti-inflammatory, analgesic, immune-boosting, uterine stimulating, and anti-aging effects. The polysaccharides enhance the immune system and improve circulatory function.
English.Notes: The roots and stems contain various chemical ingredients including achyranthes bidentata polysaccharide and ecdysterone.

Botanical: 黑斑布氏蟾蜍 (Bufo bufo melanostictua)

Chinese.Preparation: 适量外用或与膏药混合后涂抹于患处。口服：0.015到0.03克。(高度毒性)
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕期间不宜服用。外用时避免接触眼睛。
Chinese.Research: 有报道称该药用于各种类型的癌症，并具有升高血压和呼吸刺激的效果。
Chinese.Notes: 作为解毒剂，可以口服甘草和白芨的煎剂。
Chemical Ingredients: 不同的氨基酸 (Different amino acids)

English.Preparation: Use appropriate amount externally or mix with plaster and apply to affected areas. To take orally: 0.015 to 0.03g. (highly toxic).
English.Contraindications: Not to be taken during pregnancy. In external application, avoid getting into the eyes.
English.Research: It has been reported to be used in various types of cancer and possess effects of raising blood pressure and respiratory stimulation.
English.Notes: As an antidote for poisoning, a decoction of gan cao and bai ji may be taken orally.

Botanical: 大麦 (Hordeum sativum Jess. var. vulgar, Hack.)

Chinese.Preparation: 为了消化，这种草药应轻微炒制并在热水中浸泡。过热可能会破坏消化碳水化合物的淀粉酶。
Chinese.Contraindications: 为了避免增强药效，不应与麻黄、咖啡因、降血糖药物、降血压药物、增强心脏功能药物同服。
Chinese.Research: 根据FDA，符合健康声明的含大麦食品必须每份提供至少0.75克可溶性纤维。
Chinese.Notes: 焦麥芽經大麥發芽而成，將麥芽置鍋內微火炒至黃色，噴洒清水，取出晒亁，即為焦麥芽。焦麥芽具有健脾和胃，舒肝化滯之功用。

Botanical: Hordeum sativum Jess. var. vulgar, Hack.

English.Preparation: For digestion, the herb should be lightly stir fried and seep in hot water. Overheating can destroy the amylase for digesting carbohydrates.
English.Contraindications: To avoid increasing the drug effect, not to take with ma huang, caffeine, blood sugar lowering drug, blood pressure lowering drug, cardiac function enhancing drug.
English.Research: Per FDA, to qualify for health claims, the barley-containing foods must provide at least 0.75 gram of soluble fiber per serving of the food.
English.Notes: 焦麥芽經大麥發芽而成，將麥芽置鍋內微火炒至黃色，噴洒清水，取出晒亁，即為焦麥芽。焦麥芽具有健脾和胃，舒肝化滯之功用。

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量：9–15克
Chinese.Contraindications: 不宜与乌头同用。脾虚和/或腹泻者不宜服用。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究结果见于天花粉页面。

Maladies Treated: Hot and dry bowel with constipation
English.Preparation: Daily dosage: 9–15 g
English.Contraindications: It is not suitable to use together with wu tou. Not to be taken by those who are pixu (spleen deficient) and/or with diarrhea.
English.Research: Modern research findings are noted on tian hua fen page.

Maladies Treated: 感冒或流感引起的頭痛
熱症引起的咳嗽和哮喘
Chinese.Preparation: 劑量：根部 6 到 15 克（3 到 15 克）。通常用於煎湯。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不適用於脾虛消化弱的情況。在服用抗凝血藥物期間應避免使用黃芩。
Chinese.Research: 黃芩或其成分黃芩素的酒精提取物已被發現能促進膽汁分泌。該草藥表現出多種作用，包括抗炎、抗組胺、抗過敏、廣譜抗生素活性，並可能預防動脈粥樣硬化。
Chinese.Notes: 包含黃芩的方劑形式有龍膽瀉肝湯、小舒銘湯、小柴胡湯和阿膠黃芩湯。

Maladies Treated: Headache due to cold or flu
Cough and asthma due to heat syndromes
English.Preparation: Dosage: 6 to 15 g (3 to 15 grams) of the roots. Commonly used in decoction.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in cases of spleen deficiency with weak digestion. Avoid using Huang Qin while on blood thinning medication.
English.Research: Alcohol extract of Huang Qin or its component Baicalin has been found to promote bile secretion. The herb exhibits various effects including anti-inflammatory, anti-histamine, anti-allergenic, broad-spectrum antibiotic activity, and may prevent atherosclerosis.
English.Notes: Forms of herbal formulas containing Huang Qin include Long Dan Xie Gan Tang, Xiao Xu Ming Tang, Xiao Chai Hu Tang, and E Jiao Huang Qin Tang.

Chinese.Preparation: 用水煮沸並作為茶飲。劑量：6到15克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不適用於便秘的情況。
Chinese.Research: 毒性與注意事項：蓮子也稱為甜蓮子（甜蓮子種子）。烹煮前不要提前浸泡蓮子，否則煮熟後不會變軟。
Chinese.Notes: 蓮子用於慢性腹瀉。蓮子的通用劑量為4到12克，煎煮。
Chemical Ingredients: 乙酸緩衝液-可溶性果膠

English.Preparation: Boil with water and use as tea. Dosage: 6 to 15 grams.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of constipation.
English.Research: Toxicity & Cautions: Shi lian zi is also called tian lian zi (sweet lotus seeds). Do not pre-soak lian zi before cooking or it will not be soft after cooking.
English.Notes: Shi lian zi is used for chronic diarrhea. General dosage for shi lian zi is 4 to 12 grams, decoction.

Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚火旺，口干舌燥，尿黄，便秘，发热，流感或感冒者不宜使用。初始使用少量，逐渐增加剂量，以防损伤阴液，导致眼部炎症甚至出血。
Chinese.Notes: 冬季使用效果更佳。

English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yin deficiency with heat, dry mouth and tongue, yellow urine, constipation, fever, flu or cold. Use small amount first and gradually increase dosage to prevent injuries to the yin and leading to inflammation of the eyes and even leading to hemorrhage.
English.Notes: It is better to use during winter.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：6 - 10克，粉末或丸剂形式1.5 - 3克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 无湿寒或气滞证时禁用。
Chinese.Research: 提取物具有降血糖和脂质的效果，具有抗氧化性能，并能抑制乙型肝炎病毒表面抗原。

English.Preparation: For decoction: 6 - 10 g, in powder or pill form 1.5 - 3 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use when there is no syndrome of damp cold or qi stagnation.
English.Research: The extract possesses lowering blood sugar and lipid effects, possesses antioxidant properties, and can inhibit hepatitis B virus surface antigen.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：煎汤15到30克（鲜草药加倍），或浸泡在米酒中。外用：捣碎后外敷。
Chinese.Contraindications: 毒性和注意事项：对小鼠静脉注射煎剂的LD50第一次组为9.9克原药/公斤。第二组的LD50为19克原药/公斤。口服皂苷的LD50为2.21 ± 0.14克/公斤。
Chinese.Research: 在一项兔子的研究中，10mg/kg的总皂苷能显著降低血胆固醇和血压，降低心率，增加心脏收缩幅度，增加尿量，减少脂蛋白的β/α比率，改善冠状循环。对轻度动脉粥样硬化患者可能有效。穿山龙抑制口腔癌细胞的侵袭，可能有作为口腔癌转移的化学预防剂的潜在应用。它对脂肪吸收具有抑制潜力，因此可能具有抗肥胖效果。它还有抗炎效果。
Chinese.Notes: LD50是指足以在一定时间内杀死50%动物种群的有毒物质（如毒药、病毒或辐射）的量。

Common: chuan long shu yu穿龍薯蕷

English.Preparation: Oral: make into decoction, 15 to 30 g. (fresh herb, double the amount), or soak in rice wine. External application: smash and apply.
English.Contraindications: Toxicity & Cautions: Injectiones made from decoction on mice the LD50 on the first group was 9.9 g crude drug / kg. The LD50 of the second group was 19 g crude drug / kg. Oral saponins, the LD50 was 2.21 ± 0.14 g / kg.
English.Research: In a rabbit study the total saponins of 10mg/kg can significantly reduce blood cholesterol and blood pressure, lower heart rate, increase heart contraction amplitude, increase urine output, reduce the β / α ratio of lipoprotein improving coronary circulation. It may be effective for patients with mild atherosclerosis. Chuan shan long inhibited the invasion of oral cancer cells and may have potential use as a chemopreventive agent against oral cancer metastasis. It has inhibitory potential against fat absorption thus may have anti-obesity effect. It also has anti-inflammatory effects.
English.Notes: LD50 is the amount of a toxic agent (as a poison, virus, or radiation) that is sufficient to kill 50 percent of a population of animals usually within a certain time.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：6至15克。制成丸剂和粉剂：0.3至9克。外用：适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 气虚或血虚者谨慎使用。不适合外感或术后恢复者。
Chinese.Research: 体外研究表明，露蜂房可以抑制肺癌细胞，对胃癌细胞也有效。它促进血液凝固，增强心脏活动，暂时降低血压，并具有利尿作用。
Chinese.Notes: 露蜂房的油可以去除绦虫，但毒性很大，因此不推荐用于此目的。

English.Preparation: In decoction: 6 to 15 g. For pills and powder: 0.3 to 9 g. External use: appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: Caution in qi deficiency or blood deficiency. Not suitable for those with external pathogens or post-surgery recovery.
English.Research: In vitro studies show Lu Feng Fang can inhibit lung cancer cells and is effective against stomach cancer cells. It promotes blood coagulation, strengthens heart activity, lowers blood pressure temporarily, and has a diuretic effect.
English.Notes: The oil of Lu Feng Fang can remove tape worms but is highly toxic, thus not recommended for that purpose.

Botanical: Mentha arvensis var. piperascens L. Malinv. ex LH.Bailey

Chinese.Preparation: 取 2 至 10 克，煮沸短暂，不要长时间煮沸。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适用于阴虚、肝阳上升、出汗过多的患者。
Chinese.Research: 含有精油；研究其对炎症和神经系统刺激的影响。
Chinese.Notes: 常与其他草药如香薷和连翘结合使用，以增强效果。

Botanical: Mentha arvensis var. piperascens L. Malinv. ex LH.Bailey

English.Preparation: Take 2 to 10 g boiled briefly. Do not boil long.
English.Contraindications: Not to use on those who have conditions of yinxu (yin deficient), liver yang ascending, sweating profusely.
English.Research: Contains essential oil; studied for its effects on inflammation and nervous system stimulation.
English.Notes: Often combined with other herbs like xiang ru and lian qiao for enhanced effects.

Chinese.Preparation: 種子：4.5至9克；葉：9至30克
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕期不宜使用。陰虛、腎虛精洩或過勞引起的虛弱情況下需謹慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 車前子有助於排除草酸鹽。
Chinese.Notes: 種子更有效於促進排尿，而葉子更適合清除濕熱和排毒。

English.Preparation: Seeds: 4.5 to 9 g; Leaves: 9 to 30 g
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancy. Use caution in cases of yang deficiency, spermatorrhea due to kidney deficiency, or exhaustion from overwork.
English.Research: Che Qian Zi can help expel oxalate.
English.Notes: Seeds are more effective in promoting urination, while leaves are better for clearing damp heat and rid of toxicity.

Maladies Treated: Painful cold lower back and knees
Chinese.Preparation: 6-15 g, often steeped in wine or stir-fried with goat fat
Chinese.Contraindications: Contraindicated in patients with fire from yin deficiency. This herb should not be taken as a decoction, over prolonged periods, as it can damage the yin.
Chinese.Research: This herb improves quality of life and cellular immunity in patients of hemodialysis maintenance. Stir-frying with goat fat does not increase total saponin but improves efficacy.
Chinese.Notes: In some individuals, it may lead to dizziness, vomiting, dry mouth, thirst, and nose bleeding. Large doses can cause respiratory arrest.

Maladies Treated: Painful cold lower back and knees
English.Preparation: 6-15 g, often steeped in wine or stir-fried with goat fat
English.Contraindications: Contraindicated in patients with fire from yin deficiency. This herb should not be taken as a decoction, over prolonged periods, as it can damage the yin.
English.Research: This herb improves quality of life and cellular immunity in patients of hemodialysis maintenance. Stir-frying with goat fat does not increase total saponin but improves efficacy.
English.Notes: In some individuals, it may lead to dizziness, vomiting, dry mouth, thirst, and nose bleeding. Large doses can cause respiratory arrest.

Botanical: Angelica dahurica (Fisc.) Benth. et Hook. f.
Angelica dahurica (Fish.) ex Hook. f. var. Angelica taiwaniana (Boiss.) Shan et Yuan

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：3-10克。外用：适量使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在一个案例中报告过过敏反应。阴血热或阴虚（yinxu）情况不宜使用。如果脓液流动顺畅，需谨慎使用。与旋覆花相克。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究：待加载

Botanical: Angelica dahurica (Fisc.) Benth. et Hook. f.
Angelica dahurica (Fish.) ex Hook. f. var. Angelica taiwaniana (Boiss.) Shan et Yuan

Maladies Treated: headache from externally contracted wind and chill
English.Preparation: For decoction: 3-10 g. External use: use appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: Allergy reaction reported in one case. Not to use in cases of heat in blood or yin deficiency (yinxu) conditions. Use caution if puss flow is smooth. Contradicts with xuan fu hua.
English.Research: Modern Research: to be loaded

Chinese.Preparation: 成熟的木瓜可以作为水果食用。未成熟的木瓜和幼叶可以用于烹饪。
Chinese.Contraindications: 叶子含有大量的卡帕因，具有麻痹中枢神经系统的作用。大量摄入可能导致呼吸困难和心脏功能障碍。生木瓜的汁液可能会导致一些人皮肤过敏。过量食用木瓜可能导致胡萝卜素血症，表现为手掌和脚底的黄色，但这种情况被认为是无害的。
Chinese.Research: 木瓜叶的水提取物具有抗癌作用。
Chinese.Notes: 此外，植物中含有卡帕酸，并且富含维生素，主要是维生素C和A前体。

English.Preparation: Ripe papayas are eaten as fruit. Immature papayas and young leaves can be used as squash for cooking.
English.Contraindications: The leaves contain a large amount of carpaine that possesses the effect of paralyzing the CNS. Large amounts can cause difficulty in breathing and obstructing the function of the heart. Sap of raw papaya can cause skin allergy in some people. Excessive consumption of papaya can cause carotenaemia which is the yellowish color of palms and soles, but the condition is deemed harmless.
English.Research: Water extract of papaya leaves possesses anti-cancer effect.
English.Notes: In addition, the plant contains carpanic acid and is rich in vitamins, primarily vitamin C and A precursors.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎服：6到10克。大剂量可用于烹调：50-100克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在阴虚有热或湿热的情况下禁用。此草药的粘液可能延迟其他口服药物或草药的吸收。该草药的降血糖效应可能增强糖尿病药物的效果。
Chinese.Research: 此草药具有类似香豆素的抗凝血功能。它可能增强像肝素和香豆素这样的药物的效果，并可能导致出血。此草药含有胺类，可能增强单胺氧化酶抑制剂（MAOIs）的效果。
Chinese.Notes: 米水是指煮米饭时，煮沸后，米饭未煮熟前从米锅中取出的一些水。
Chemical Ingredients: 三氮唑苷 Ia-Ib, IIa-IIb, IIIa-IIIb

Maladies Treated: Cold and pain in the testes
English.Preparation: In decoction: 6 to 10 g. Large dosage can be used in meal cooking: 50 -100 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with heat or with damp-heat. The mucilage of this herb may delay absorption of other oral drugs or herbs. The hypoglycemic effect of herb may increase the effect of diabetes drugs.
English.Research: This herb possesses the function of blood thinning effect like coumarin. It may increase the effect of drug like heparin and coumarin and may cause bleeding. This herb contains amines and may increase the effect of monoamine oxydase inhibitors (MAOIs).
English.Notes: Rice water means while cooking rice, after boiling take out some water from the rice pot before rice is cooked.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：3到4.5克。粉末形式：1到1.5克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚且伴有贫血或因阴虚火旺导致的肌肉痉挛者禁用。
Chinese.Research: 见化学成分。
Chinese.Notes: 治疗风湿病、痉挛性肌腱和肌肉：将此药与细辛、独活、威灵仙等药物结合；治疗面瘫、言语困难、痉挛性肌腱、肌肉麻木与瘫痪：可与全蝎、当归、羌活、白芷结合使用，或浸泡于酒中口服。治疗破伤风、小儿抽搐及抽搐性痉挛，可与五爪蛇、乌龟及其他药物结合。治疗麻风和疥疮：可以止痛并抑制感染。

English.Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 4.5 g. In powder form: 1 to 1.5 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to use by those with yinxu (yin deficient) with anemia, or spastic muscles caused by yin deficient with fire.
English.Research: See chemical ingredients.
English.Notes: For treatment of rheumatism, spastic tendons and muscles: combine this herb with xiqian cao, du huo, wei ling xian, and other herbs; for treatment of facial paralysis, speech difficulty, spastic tendon, numbness and paralysis of muscles: combine with quan xie, dang gui, qiang huo, bai zhi, or soaked in wine for oral consumption. For treatment of tetanus, convulsion and convulsion spasm in small children, combine with wu shao she, wu gong and other herbs. For treatment of leprosy and scabies: it can arrest pain and inhibit infection.

Maladies Treated: 因熱病引起的高燒、癲狂和抽搐
因肝熱引起的高燒抽搐
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕婦或有脾虛、胃虛和寒冷的人不應使用。與龍骨、生地黃、龍膽草、長山和牛膝相互矛盾。
Chinese.Research: 一些患者在使用牛黃解毒片後出現皮膚和粘膜反應。使用抗組胺藥可以解決這些過敏反應。

Maladies Treated: High fever with delirium and convulsion due to hot diseases
Abscesses that have ripened and ruptured
Convulsions with high fever due to liver heat
English.Preparation: Dosage: 0.15 ∼ 1 g
English.Contraindications: Not to be used by pregnant women or those with spleen deficiency and stomach deficiency and cold. Contradicts with long gu, sheng di huang, long dan cao, chang shan, and niu xi.
English.Research: Some patients after using niu huang jie du pian developed skin and mucous reaction. Using anti-histamine will solve those allergic reactions.

Chinese.Preparation: 煮熟后可用量为20到30片，以减少毒性。
Chinese.Contraindications: 含有氢氰酸；吃20到30片可能会引起毒性反应；不建议小孩食用，不应用于阴虚和大便稀松的咳嗽。
Chinese.Research: 杏仁种子富含脂肪，可以降低胆固醇水平。
Chinese.Notes: 南杏仁较温和，更适合身体较弱的老年人。北杏仁较强，通常在处方中引用。

English.Preparation: Can be used in doses of 20 to 30 pieces after cooking to reduce toxicity.
English.Contraindications: Contains hydrogen cyanide; eating 20 to 30 pieces can cause toxic reactions; not recommended for small children and should not be used for cough with yin deficiency and loose bowels.
English.Research: Apricot seeds contain an abundance of fat and can lower cholesterol levels.
English.Notes: Southern xing ren is milder and more suitable for older individuals with weaker bodies. Northern xing ren is stronger and generally referenced in prescriptions.

Chinese.Research: 研究表明具有抗糖尿病、抗炎和免疫调节等活性。

English.Research: Studies have shown activities such as anti-diabetic, anti-inflammatory, and immuno-modulatory properties.

Maladies Treated: 肝阳上亢导致的头痛和眩晕
Chinese.Preparation: 口服：与水研磨，0.9-1.5克。煎剂使用1.5克至3克。或者制成丸剂或添加到其他粉剂方中。
Chinese.Contraindications: 胆经没有热时不要使用此草药。
Chinese.Research: 在切断迷走神经的猫中，降压效果减弱；这表明中枢神经系统可能与血压反应有关。小剂量的煎剂或酒精提取物增强孤立蟾蜍心脏的收缩。中等剂量抑制心脏传导信号。大剂量导致心率和振幅减慢，最终导致心脏骤停。
Chemical Ingredients: 17种氨基酸，包括赖氨酸、丝氨酸、谷氨酸、苯丙氨酸、 leucine、天冬氨酸、酪氨酸
5种磷脂，包括卵磷脂、脑磷脂、神经酰胺、磷脂酰丝氨酸、磷脂酰肌醇

Maladies Treated: Headache and dizziness due to liver yang ascending
English.Preparation: Oral: Grind with water, 0.9-1.5 g. For decoction, use 1.5 g to 3 g. Or, make into pills or add to other powder formula.
English.Contraindications: Do not use this herb if there is no heat in the gall bladder channel.
English.Research: The antihypertensive effect weakened in cats with severed vagus nerves; indicating that the central nervous system may be related to blood pressure response. Small doses of decoction or alcohol extract strengthen the contraction of isolated toad heart. Moderate doses inhibited the heart conduction signal. Large doses caused a slowdown in heart rate and amplitude, ultimately leading to cardiac arrest.
Chemical Ingredients: 17 kinds of amino acids, including lysine, serine, glutamic acid, phenylalanine, leucine, aspartic acid, tyrosine
5 types of phospholipids, including lecithin, cephalin, sphingomyelin, phosphatidylserine, phosphatidylinositol

Maladies Treated: 由于肺气虚引起的慢性咳嗽
Chinese.Preparation: 每日 dosage of 3-10 g.
Chinese.Contraindications: 在咳血、鼻出血、眼出血、痔疮出血或非月经期大量阴道出血的情况下，禁用此药草。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，木耳多糖具有强抗凝、抗血小板聚集、抗血栓、免疫刺激、降低血脂、抗衰老、抗辐射、抗炎、抗溃疡、降血糖、抗生育、抗癌和抗诱变作用。
Chinese.Notes: 木耳多糖的LD50为789.60 ± 92.19 mg/kg。根据各项实验研究，多糖具有显著的生物活性。

Maladies Treated: Chronic cough due to lung Qi deficiency
English.Preparation: Daily dosage of 3-10 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use this herb in cases of coughing blood, nose bleeding, bleeding from the eyes, bleeding hemorrhoids, or excessive vaginal bleeding not during menses.
English.Research: Research indicates that mu er polysaccharides have strong anti-clotting, anti-platelet aggregation, anti-thrombotic, immunostimulatory, hypolipidemic, anti-aging, anti-radiation, anti-inflammatory, anti-ulcer, hypoglycemic, anti-fertility, anti-cancer, and anti-mutagenic effects.
English.Notes: LD50 of mu er polysaccharides is 789.60 ± 92.19 mg/kg. The polysaccharides have significant biological activities according to various experimental studies.

Maladies Treated: 因脾虚导致的阴道分泌物
Chinese.Preparation: 这种草药以生用为主，但需谨慎，因为可能具有毒性。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在间歇性寒战和发热或感冒流感的情况下不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 对人类红细胞有聚集作用；显示对胰蛋白酶和淀粉酶的抑制作用。
Chinese.Notes: 扁豆衣是扁豆的皮。它的利尿和清热解中暑效果强于扁豆（平豆），但其健脾消化效果远弱于扁豆。

Maladies Treated: vagina discharge due to spleen deficiency
English.Preparation: The herb is used in its raw form, though caution is advised as it can be toxic.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of intermittent chills and fevers or in cold or flu.
English.Research: Shows aggregation effect on human red blood cells; shows inhibition of the effect of trypsin and amylase.
English.Notes: Bian dou yi is the skin of bian dou. Its diuretic and clearing heat stroke effects are stronger than those of bian dou (flat bean) but its strengthening digestion effect is far weaker.

Chinese.Preparation: 3到9克。對於慢性疲勞綜合症：20克紅景天，20克黃芪，15克當歸，30克黨參，15克白術，12克酸棗仁，10克石菖蒲，12克砂元子，10克山竹茹，15克茯苓。用水煮成茶。
Chinese.Contraindications: 應在早上服用，以避免干擾睡眠或做出清晰的夢。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，紅景天提取物可能增加果蠅的壽命，並具有多種治療效果，包括抗氧化特性、情緒增強以及潛在的抗癌能力。
Chinese.Notes: 這種藥材在各種配方中傳統上用於解決氣虛並支持思維清晰和身體耐力。

English.Preparation: 3 to 9 g. For chronic fatigue syndrome: 20g of hong jing tian, 20g of huang qi, 15g of dang gui, 30g of dang shen, 15g of bai zhu, 12g of suan zao ren, 10g of shi chang pu, 12g of sha yuan zi, 10g of shan zhu yu, and 15g of fu ling. Boil with water to make tea.
English.Contraindications: Should be taken early in the day to avoid interference with sleep or vivid dreams.
English.Research: Studies indicate that Rhodiola rosea extract may increase lifespan in fruit flies and has numerous therapeutic effects, including antioxidant properties, mood enhancement, and potential cancer-fighting abilities.
English.Notes: This herb has been traditionally used in various formulations to address qi deficiency and support mental clarity and physical endurance.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：煎剂 3 - 6 克；或制成粉末口服。外用：制成粉末吹入喉咙，或者用于刷牙，或者制成煎剂洗涤患处，或熬成膏状提取物涂抹于患处。
Chinese.Contraindications: 暂无已知副作用。避免直接接触眼睛。
Chinese.Research: 当前文献中未记录不良反应。

English.Preparation: For oral consumption: for decoction 3 - 6 g; or make into powder and take orally. External use: make into powder and blow into throat, or for brushing teeth, or make into decoction for washing the affected area, or simmer into extract of paste and apply to affected areas.
English.Contraindications: No known side effect. Avoid direct contact with eyes.
English.Research: Currently, no adverse reactions have been documented in the literature.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：3到10克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚和热症患者禁用。不宜长期使用。
Chinese.Research: 仙茅酒精提取物具有抗氧化和保护肝脏的作用。
Chinese.Notes: 无

English.Preparation: Dosage: 3 to 10 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in case of yinxu (yin deficient) and heat. Not for long term use.
English.Research: Xian Mao alcohol extract possesses antioxidant and hepatoprotective effects.
English.Notes: None

Chinese.Preparation: 口服用：与水研磨或制成粉末：0.9克到1.8克。煎剂：1.5克到6克。外用：与水研磨后涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕期间或没有高热的疾病情况下不宜使用。脾虚者不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 水牛角可作为替代品。
Chinese.Notes: 水牛角作为犀角的替代品在临床使用中很常见。

English.Preparation: For oral use: grind with water or make into powder: 0.9 g to 1.8 g. For decoction: 1.5 g to 6 g. For external application: grind with water and apply.
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancy or in cases of sickness without high fever. Do not use in cases of spleen deficiency.
English.Research: Buffalo horn can be used as a substitute.
English.Notes: Clinical use of buffalo horn as a substitute for rhinoceros horn is common.

Chinese.Preparation: 通常使用10至15克。大剂量可为30至120克。为促进消化，使用烘焙（炒过的）山楂；对于血瘀，使用生山楂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 脾虚且无消化不良时不宜使用。在胃酸过多、胃溃疡或妊娠（以避免早产）的情况下谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 多种山楂提取物具有心脏兴奋作用，小剂量具有降压作用，总类黄酮可以改善冠脉循环并具有抗心律失常特性。山楂溶液能够显著降低血胆固醇和甘油三酯，其提取物具有抗菌作用。
Chinese.Notes: 在现代，山楂用于治疗高脂血症、动脉硬化和高血压。

Maladies Treated: Acute pain in chest and abdomen
English.Preparation: Generally 10 to 15 g. Large dosage can be 30 to 120 g. To improve digestion, use baked (stir fried) shan zha. For blood stasis, use raw shan zha.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in case of spleen deficiency without indigestion. Use with care in cases of overabundance of stomach acid, peptic ulcers, or pregnancies (to avoid premature delivery).
English.Research: Many types of extract from shan zha possess cardiac stimulant effect, smaller dosages possess hypotensive effect, and total flavonoid can improve coronary circulation and has anti-arrhythmia properties. Shan zha solution can lower blood cholesterol and triglycerides significantly. Its extracts have antibacterial effects.
English.Notes: It is modernly used in cases of high lipids, arteriosclerosis, and hypertension.

Chinese.Preparation: 用量：15至30克。例：急性黄疸型肝炎：板蓝根30克，栀子根45克。煮成汤剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不宜在没有火毒或虚弱患者中使用。有报道指出，长期使用可能导致内出血和对造血功能的损伤。注射可能引起的过敏反应包括头晕、皮疹、嘴唇和面部紫绀、四肢麻木，严重时可导致休克。大量使用和/或长期使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Research: 板蓝根显著抑制了腺苷二磷酸诱导的家兔血小板聚集。化学成分如尿苷、髓氨酸、嘧啶和水杨酸也表现出对ATP诱导的血小板聚集的抑制活性。
Chinese.Notes: 对区分板蓝根的研究强调了它的多种名称和分类。

Maladies Treated: ulcer of the mouth in children
English.Preparation: Dosage: 15 to 30 g. Example: Acute hepatitis with jaundice: ban lan gen 30 g, zhi zi root 45 g. Make into concoction.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in absence of fire toxin or in weak patients. There are reports of prolonged usage causing internal bleeding and injury to blood producing function. Possible allergic reactions from injections include dizziness, rash, purple lips and face, numbness in limbs, and in serious cases, shock. Large dosages and/or long term usage can be toxic to kidneys.
English.Research: Ban lan gen significantly inhibited platelet aggregation induced by adenosine diphosphate on domesticated rabbits. Chemical components such as uridine, hypoxanthine, pyrimidine, and salicylic acid also exhibited inhibitory activity on ATP-induced platelet aggregation.
English.Notes: The study of distinguishing ban lan gen herb highlights its various names and classifications.

Maladies Treated: 伴有出血或脓液的痔疮
Chinese.Preparation: 口服，煎剂：9至15克，或混合成丸剂或粉末。外用：适量粉末或制成膏药。
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕时需谨慎使用。
Chinese.Notes: 对于慢性阴道分泌物，根据症状调整方剂。

English.Preparation: Taking orally, in decoction: 9 to 15 g, or mix into pill or powder. External application: use appropriate amount in powder form or make into paste.
English.Contraindications: Use care in case of pregnancy.
English.Notes: For chronic vaginal discharge, adjust the formula according to the syndrome.

Chinese.Preparation: 3–15克煎汤内服，外用适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 如果没有潮湿热，不得使用。
Chinese.Research: 水提取物抑制真菌并对免疫系统有影响。
Chinese.Notes: 这种草药的种子被用作假冒替代品：白蒿，豆瓣干，黑莨菪。

Maladies Treated: Inflammations and infections of the urinary bladder
English.Preparation: 3–15 g in decoction for internal use. Use appropriate amount for external application.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used if it is not damp heat.
English.Research: Water extract inhibits fungi and has effects on the immune system.
English.Notes: Seeds of this herb are being used as a fake substitute: Chenopodium album, Baeckea frutescens, Hyoscyamus niger.

Maladies Treated: 因母乳过多引起的疼痛
Chinese.Preparation: 对急性乳腺炎：使用15片王不留行与生半夏（1/2片）、白芥子（5片）和生姜。捣碎后用纱布包好，插入鼻孔。对带状疱疹：配方1：30克王不留行与1或2个鸡蛋，低温烘烤，磨碎后将蛋白混入成糊状。配方2：12克与芝麻油混成糊状。每天在患处涂抹2-3次。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕妇使用时要注意。不得用于乳腺癌治疗；有效的治疗是去除肿瘤，以防扩散。
Chinese.Research: 王不留行可以抑制埃希里希腹水癌和肺癌。
Chinese.Notes: 此草药可以作为催乳剂。

Maladies Treated: Acute inflammation of the mammary gland
Pain due to overabundance of mother's milk
English.Preparation: For acute mastitis: Use 15 pieces of wang bu liu xing with raw ban xia (1/2 piece), bai jie zi (5 pieces), and raw ginger. Smash in gauze, insert into nostril. For herpes zoster: Formula 1: 30 g of wang bu liu xing with 1 or 2 eggs, bake low heat, grind, mix egg white into paste. Formula 2: 12 g with sesame oil into paste. Apply to affected area 2-3 times a day.
English.Contraindications: Use care in cases of pregnancy. Not for breast cancer therapy; effective therapy is to remove tumors before they spread.
English.Research: Wang bu liu xing can inhibit Ehrlich ascites cancer and lung cancer.
English.Notes: The herb can be used as a lactagogue.

Chinese.Contraindications: 在阴虚火旺，或排尿短促和（或）困难，或阴茎勃起异常的情况下应谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 其醇提取物能够纠正实验鼠肾阳不足的状况。
Chinese.Notes: 鞣酸具有抗生素、抗病毒和抗癌的效果，特别有效于治疗人在子宫颈癌和结肠癌。

English.Preparation: Dosage: 6∼12 g.
English.Contraindications: Use caution in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with fire, or in short and/or difficulty in urination, or in priapism.
English.Research: Its alcohol extract can correct the condition of kidney yang deficient of lab mice.
English.Notes: Ellagic acid possesses antibiotic, antiviral, and anti-cancer effects, notably effective for treating uterine cervical cancer and colon cancer in humans.

Chinese.Preparation: 以丸剂或粉剂形式使用：0.3克至0.9克。外用时，使用适量。要促进呕吐：使用防风、瓜荔、藜蘆。磨成细粉。用温开水服用少量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕妇或身体虚弱时不要服用藜蘆。它具有强毒性，可能导致致命后果。
Chinese.Research: 藜蘆的生物碱主要影响运动和感觉神经、迷走神经和中枢神经系统，起初刺激，然后导致麻痹，可能导致因中枢神经系统麻痹呼吸系统而死亡。
Chinese.Notes: 藜蘆非常毒。剂量为0.3至0.9克。服用此药引起的呕吐可通过饮用葱白的汤剂来停止。

English.Preparation: In pill or powder form: 0.3 g to 0.9 g. For external application, use appropriate amount. To promote vomiting: Use fang feng, gua di, li lu. Grind into fine powder. Take a small amount with warm drinking water.
English.Contraindications: Do not take li lu in cases of pregnancies or if the body is weak. It has a strong toxicity with potential fatal effects.
English.Research: The alkaloids of li lu primarily affect motor and sensory nerves, the vagus nerves, and the CNS, initially stimulating and then paralyzing, potentially leading to death due to CNS paralysis of the respiratory system.
English.Notes: Li lu is very poisonous. The dosage is 0.3 to 0.9 gram. Vomit caused by taking this herb can be stopped by drinking the decoction of the white portion of green onion.

Chinese.Preparation: 3至9克，煎剂或酊剂。连续服用几天。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不要在无内湿热、气虚、少液、遗精、频尿或怀孕期间使用。关木通对肾有毒。
Chinese.Research: 在兔子身上观察到明显的利尿效果。还显示出抗菌和抗炎效果。口服毒性低，但注射可能有一定的毒性。
Chinese.Notes: 目前在中国使用的95%的木通来源于弱肋防己，因肾毒性被禁止。在美国市场存在误标问题，样本中含有防己酸。

English.Preparation: 3 to 9 g, decoction or tincture. Administered over several days.
English.Contraindications: Do not use on those without internal damp heat, fluid deficient, qi deficient, spermatorrhea, frequent urination, or during pregnancy. Guan mu tong is toxic to kidneys.
English.Research: Significant diuretic effect was observed in rabbits. Also showed antibacterial and anti-inflammatory effects. Low oral toxicity but certain toxic injection.
English.Notes: 95% of mu tong used in China today is from Aristolochia debilis, which is banned due to kidney toxicity. Mislabeling concerns in the U.S. market where samples contained aristolochic acid.

Chinese: yue xia mei ren 月下美人

Chinese.Preparation: 每日9~18克
Chinese.Contraindications: 脾虚时不要饮用生汁。

Chinese: yue xia mei ren 月下美人

Maladies Treated: Cough due to heat in the lung
English.Preparation: 9~18 g per day
English.Contraindications: Do not drink the raw juice of the herb in case of pixu (spleen deficient).

Botanical: Amomum villosum Lour.var. xanthioides T.L.Wu et Senjen

Chinese.Preparation: 3至6克。不要长时间烹煮。入汤剂宜后下。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚有热者忌用。
Chinese.Research: 毒性与注意事项：砂壳是砂仁的外壳。它也有理气醒胃的作用，但缺乏砂仁温中散寒的效力。砂壳气味薄，燥性小，肝旺胃弱者用之较为适宜。
Chinese.Notes: 砂壳是砂仁的外壳。它可以帮助消化，但缺乏砂仁的温热效应。它更适合肝旺胃弱者使用。

Botanical: Amomum villosum Lour.var. xanthioides T.L.Wu et Senjen

English.Preparation: 3 to 6 g. Do not cook for long time.入湯剤，宜後下。
English.Contraindications: not to use in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with heat陰虛有熱者忌用。
English.Research: Toxicity & Cautions: 砂殼是砂仁的外殼。它也有理氣醒胃的作用，但缺乏砂仁溫中散寒的效力。砂殼氣味薄，燥性小，肝旺胃弱者用之較為適宜。
English.Notes: Sha ke is the shell of sha ren. It can help with digestion but lacks the warming effect of sha ren. It is more suitable for weak stomach with over active liver.

Botanical: 无刺枣 Ziziphus jujuba Mill. var. inermis Bge.

Maladies Treated: 非低血小板计数所致紫癜
Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：使用3到10片。大枣用开水稍焯水后晒干。使用前通常去核。
Chinese.Contraindications: 大枣助湿热，可能导致胀气、消化不良和寄生虫生长。热性咳嗽或酵母感染病例中应避免使用。在脾虚和消化弱的情况下应谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 最近的研究显示大枣对中枢神经系统有镇静作用，对小鼠CCL4伤害后具有肝保护效果，并显著提高小鼠的肌肉力量和体重。
Chinese.Notes: 大枣呈黑色，而红枣较小且呈红色。二者来自同一水果，但加工方法不同。

Botanical: Ziziphus jujuba Mill. var. inermis Bge.

Maladies Treated: Purpura not due to low platelet count
English.Preparation: Dosage: Use 3 to 10 pieces. Da zao are prepared by blanching slightly in boiling water and drying under the sun. The pits are often removed before use.
English.Contraindications: Da zao promotes damp heat, which can lead to flatulence, indigestion, and parasite growth. Avoid in cases of heat-type cough or yeast infection. Use with caution in spleen deficiency and weak digestion.
English.Research: Recent studies show CNS sedative effects of da zao, liver protective effects following CCl4 injury in rabbits, and significant increases in muscle strength and body weight in mice after feeding da zao decoction.
English.Notes: Da zao are black in color while hong zao are smaller and red in color. Both come from the same fruit; however, their preparation methods differ.

Chinese.Preparation: 新鲜药材：10-15克；干药材：3到6克煎汤；精油：几滴。
Chinese.Contraindications: 过量使用会导致头痛和胃部不适。可能刺激敏感皮肤。在皮肤炎症或湿疹上不要使用。
Chinese.Research: 精油具有抗真菌效果。报告显示叶子和根部含有类胰岛素物质，具有降糖和降脂作用。香茅醛具有抗癌效果。
Chinese.Notes: 新鲜的香茅在中国药材店中不售，但在美国的越南/中国市场或东印度市场可以找到。

English.Preparation: Fresh herb: 10-15 grams; Dry herb: 3 to 6 grams for decoction; Essential oil: a few drops.
English.Contraindications: Over usage causes headache and uneasiness in stomach. It may irritate sensitive skin. Do not use on skin inflammation or eczema.
English.Research: The essential oil possesses antifungal effects. Reports suggest the leaves and roots contain an insulin-like substance with hypoglycemic and hypolipidemic effects. Citral has anti-cancer effects.
English.Notes: Fresh xiang mao (lemon grass) is not sold in Chinese herb stores but can be found in Vietnamese/Chinese markets or East Indian markets in America.

Chinese.Preparation: 干草药：15至60克。鲜草药：60克至120克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在脾虚和因胃虚而导致的胃寒情况下，不宜使用，或在怀孕期间不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 与抗溶血相关的抗氧化作用可能与马齿莧提取物的抗氧化特性有关。
Chinese.Notes: 被认为是更有效的药用植物的绿色茎马齿莧。弱体质可能会导致腹泻。

English.Preparation: Dry herb: 15 to 60 g. Fresh herb: 60 g to 120 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in case of spleen deficiency and stomach cold from stomach deficiency, or during pregnancy.
English.Research: Anti-oxidation effects related to cytoprotective properties against hemolysis may be linked to the antioxidant properties of P. oleracea extracts.
English.Notes: The green stem ma chi xian is considered more effective for medical purposes. May cause diarrhea in weak constitutions.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量：15克至40克。对于吐血性萎缩性肺病：用萊菔与羊肉或鲤鱼煮汤，常服。对于便秘：炒一杯萊菔，加入水搅拌成糊状，加入枣佳7.5克（制成粉末）。口服。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不与何首乌或地黄同用。
Chinese.Research: 酒精提取物具有抗生素特性，尤其对革兰阳性细菌有效；但在血清中，其活性仅为50%。根的汁液能防止胆结石的形成。

Maladies Treated: Atrophic lung disease with vomiting blood
English.Preparation: Daily dosage: 15 g to 40 g. For atrophic lung disease with vomiting blood: use lai fu with goat meat or carp to make soup. Take frequently. For constipation: stir fry one cup of lai fu, add water and blend into paste. Add zao jia 7.5 g (make into powder). Take orally.
English.Contraindications: Do not use with he shou wu or di huang.
English.Research: The alcohol extract possesses antibiotic property, especially toward Gram-positive bacteria; but in serum, the viability is only 50%. The juice of the radix can prevent the formation of gallstones.

Botanical: Rhus chinensis Mill. var. roxburghii (DC) Rehd

Chinese.Preparation: 根：10到35克；五倍子：2到7克；外用的花和叶：适量使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 未指定。
Chinese.Research: 未指定。
Chinese.Notes: 药用部位包括根、叶、花、果和五倍子，收集于夏季和秋季。外用用于烫伤和局部出血的伤害。

Botanical: Rhus chinensis Mill. var. roxburghii (DC) Rehd

English.Preparation: Root: 10 to 35 g; wu bei zi: 2 to 7 g; Flower and leaves in external application: use appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: Not specified.
English.Research: Not specified.
English.Notes: The parts being used in medicine include roots, leaves, flowers, fruit, and wu bei zi, collected in summer and fall. External application is used for injuries from scalding and local bleeding.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量：3-5克
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚火旺者禁用。与桑葚皂角相配。与泽泻、肉桂、雷丸、蛇臀不相容。与兔丝子相互抵消。阳痿如因情志损伤或月经时出血过多禁用。

English.Preparation: Daily dosage: 3-5 g
English.Contraindications: Not to use in case of yin deficient with heat. Compatible with sang piao xiao. Not compatible with ze xie, rou gui, lei wan, she tui. Counteracts with tu si zi. Not to use for impotence caused by emotional injuries or with heavy bleeding during menses.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：4.5 至 9 克。外用时，使用适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 如果没有强热症状，请小心使用。
Chinese.Research: 体外实验表明，拳參的各种提取物对多种细菌具有抗生素效果。在动物研究中，它还显示了抗炎、镇痛和镇静效果。值得注意的是，拳參中的 L-表儿茶素可以降低胆固醇水平，并具有抗癌特性。
Chinese.Notes: 拳參不是气叶依知华或虫螺。它特别指Polygonum bistorta L.或Polygonum Lapidosum Kitag.的根茎。
Chemical Ingredients: 槲皮素-5-O-β-D-葡萄糖吡喃糖苷

English.Preparation: Dosage: 4.5 to 9 g. For external application, use an appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: Use with care if there is not strong heat syndrome.
English.Research: In vitro experiments showed that various extracts of quan shen possess antibiotic effects on multiple bacteria. It has also shown anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and sedative effects in animal studies. Notably, L-epicatechin in quan shen can reduce cholesterol levels and has anti-cancer properties.
English.Notes: Quan shen is not qi ye yi zhi hua or chong lou. It is specifically the rhizome of Polygonum bistorta L. or Polygonum Lapidosum Kitag.

Maladies Treated: 慢性结肠炎引起的腹痛
Chinese.Preparation: 3到10克。包裹并与水煮沸。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不宜用于由于血瘀导致的出血和怀孕期间。生蒲黄可以收缩子宫，因此孕妇应避免使用；但在分娩后缺乏收缩导致的出血可以使用。该草药可能对肝脏有毒。

Maladies Treated: Abdominal ache due to chronic colitis
English.Preparation: 3 to 10 g. Wrap and boil with water.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of bleeding due to blood stasis and during pregnancy. Raw pu huang can constrict uterus, so pregnant women should avoid using it; but it can be used in bleeding due to lack of constriction after giving birth. The herb can be toxic to the liver.

Chinese.Preparation: 根部可以用來潤肺、止咳、養胃、產生津液，並清熱。
Chinese.Contraindications: 對於風寒引起的咳嗽或脾虛的情況下不應使用。避免與李露或防己同用。
Chinese.Research: 現代研究結果將上傳。
Chinese.Notes: 該藥材具有補陰、清肺、產生津液等功能。

English.Preparation: Roots can be used to moisten lungs, stop coughs, nourish stomach, generate fluids, and clear heat.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cough due to wind cold, or in cases of spleen deficiency. Avoid use with li lu or fang ji.
English.Research: Modern research findings to be uploaded.
English.Notes: Herb has functions such as nourishing yin, clearing the lungs, and generating fluids.

Maladies Treated: 多脏器功能障碍综合症 (MODS)
Chinese.Preparation: 要达到泻下作用，使用生大黄。烹煮超过10分钟会降低其泻下效果。要止血，请使用焦大黄。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适合脾虚（脾虚）患者。长期使用不推荐。在长期使用大黄后骤然停止使用可能会导致便秘。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明，大黄可以抑制柯萨奇病毒B3，并诱导细胞变化，从而阻止病毒复制。
Chinese.Notes: 烹煮大黄超过10分钟会降低其泻下效果。大黄的正宗药用植物是干燥的根和根茎，来源于Rheum palmatum L.、Rheum tanguticum Maxim.或Rheum officinale Baill。
Chemical Ingredients: 2-O-肉桂酰 - l,6-二-O-没食子酸-β-D-葡萄糖苷

Maladies Treated: Sudden stoppage of heart or respiration
English.Preparation: For purgative effect use raw da huang. Cooking for more than 10 minutes will reduce its purgative effect. To stop bleeding use charred da huang.
English.Contraindications: Not suitable for patients with spleen deficiency (pixu). Long term usage is not recommended. Constipation may follow after sudden dropping of usage of da huang after long period of time.
English.Research: Research indicates that da huang can inhibit Coxsackie virus B3 and induce cellular changes that stop the virus from multiplying.
English.Notes: Cooking da huang for more than 10 minutes will reduce its purgative effect. Authentic medicinal plants of the herb da huang are dried roots and rhizomes of Rheum palmatum L., Rheum tanguticum Maxim. or Rheum officinale Baill.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：每天 6 ~ 16 克。方剂样本包括：(1) 促进排尿和愈合脓疮：金银花 6 克，甘草 3 克，水 600 毫升。小火煮至 200 毫升，分三次服用；(2) 排脓解毒：金银花 10 克，天花粉 10 克，生黄芪 6 克，穿山甲 6 克，党参 6 克，桔梗 6 克，皂荚 6 克，白芷 4 克。加水 600 毫升，小火煮至 200 毫升，加入黄米酒 100 毫升，分三次服用。(3) 减少粉刺：金银花 30 克，甘草 5 克。用 2000 毫升水煮沸，慢煮 15 分钟，作为每日茶饮。
Chinese.Contraindications: 因其寒凉特性，对于发热应使用较小剂量，对于脓疖应使用较大剂量。因其寒凉性质不宜长期使用。在阳虚的情况下使用时需谨慎。
Chinese.Research: 请见研究图书管理员
Chinese.Notes: 如果您需要有关化学成分和现代研究的详细信息，可以联系研究图书管理员。

Maladies Treated: acute infection of the mammary glands
English.Preparation: Dosage: 6 ~ 16 g daily. Samples of formulae include: (1) for promoting urination and healing sores with pus: jin yin hua 6 g, gan cao 3 g, water 600 c.c. Simmer to 200 c.c. made into 3 servings a day; (2) for expelling pus and toxins: jin yin hua 10 g, tian hua fen 10 g, sheng huang qi 6 g, chuan shan jia 6 g, dang gui 6 g, jie geng 6 g, zao jia ci 6 g, bai zhi 4 g. Add water 600 c.c. Simmer to 200 c.c. Add yellow rice wine 100 c.c. made into 3 servings a day. (3) for lessening pimples: jin yin hua 30 g, gan cao 5 g. Boil with 2000 c.c. of water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Use as daily tea.
English.Contraindications: Use smaller dosage for fever and larger dosage for boils due to toxic heat. Not for long term usage because of its cool property. Use caution in cases of yangxu (yang deficient) condition.
English.Research: see research librarian
English.Notes: If you need more detailed information on chemical ingredients and modern research you can email the Research Librarian.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂用于滴药或内服，每日剂量为5-10克种子或花。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在青光眼或肝肾虚弱的情况下不要使用，因为其强力清热的效果可能导致瞳孔扩张。
Chinese.Research: 用于治疗高血压、抗炎、扩张血管，并对阴道滴虫有效。
Chinese.Notes: 鸡冠花（Celosia cristata L.）和青葙（Celosia argentea L.）同属一科但不同种，可以互换使用。

Maladies Treated: Diarrhea with red and white mucus
English.Preparation: Decoction used as drops or internal use, dosage is 5-10 grams of seed or flower per day.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of glaucoma or liver or kidney deficiency due to its strong heat clearing effect and potential to dilate the pupils.
English.Research: Used in treating hypertension, anti-inflammation, dilates blood vessels, and effective against Trichomonas vaginalis.
English.Notes: ji guan hua (Celosia cristata L.) and qing xiang (Celosia argentea L.) are of the same family but different species and can be used interchangeably.

Chinese.Preparation: 0.06 到 0.15 克，以丸、粉、贴、敷的形式使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕妇禁用，有热的阴虚病例应谨慎使用。高血压病例需谨慎。
Chinese.Research: 观察到毒性和注意事项；高血压患者需高度谨慎。
Chinese.Notes: 合成的射香被广泛使用，取代了供应不足的天然射香。

English.Preparation: 0.06 to 0.15 g in pills, powders, plasters, compresses.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of pregnancies, and in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with heat. Use caution in cases of hypertension.
English.Research: Toxicity and cautions noted; high caution required for hypertensive individuals.
English.Notes: Synthesized she xiang widely used, replacing natural she xiang which is short in supply.

Chinese.Preparation: 新鮮的風車草可作為蔬菜使用：100 克。
Chinese.Contraindications: [1] Am J Chin Med. 2010;38(3):495-516. [2] J Ethnopharmacol. 2011年3月24日;134(2):379-85. Epub 2010年12月30日. [3] Journal of the Science of Food and Agriculture, 89: 2678–2686. doi: 10.1002/jsfa.3774 [4] J Sci Food Agric. 2011年5月;91(7):1230-5. doi: 10.1002/jsfa.4304. Epub 2011年3月8日。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明具有抗氧化和抗炎作用，對CCl(4)誘導的氧化性肝損傷具有肝保護作用，並可能具有抗高血壓的益處。

English.Preparation: Fresh feng che cao can be used as a vegetable: 100 grams.
English.Contraindications: [1] Am J Chin Med. 2010;38(3):495-516. [2] J Ethnopharmacol. 2011 Mar 24;134(2):379-85. Epub 2010 Dec 30.
