English.Contraindications: It contains oxalic acid. Using large amounts can be toxic to the kidneys. Do not substitute yang ti with da huang for external use.
English.Research: Study of the chemical ingredients of Rumex confertus Willd. by Chang Li et al.
English.Notes: Although yang ti is also called tu da huang, tu da huang is not da huang. External application cannot be substituted with da huang.

Chinese.Preparation: 內服：0.3-0.6 克促進嘔吐。方劑：丹礬 3 克，瓜蒂 3 克。磨成細粉。用水服用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 體虛時不宜使用。

English.Preparation: Internal use: 0.3-0.6 g for promoting vomiting. For formula: dan fan 3 g, gua di 3 g. Make into fine powder. Take with water.
English.Contraindications: Not to use when the body is weak.

Chinese.Preparation: 內服：0.8到1.6克，烘焙後製成丸或粉劑。外用視情況需要，灑或作為溶液塗抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 內服有時可能引起嘔吐、腹瀉、頭暈。過去三個月內有出血性潰瘍者不得使用。孕婦禁用。服用此藥時不宜飲茶。大劑量可致死。
Chinese.Notes: 皂礬的顏色為綠色或綠黑色結晶。最初用於染黑，因此得名。加熱後變為Fe2O3，這是一種非常細的粉末，具有非常活躍的特性。

English.Preparation: Internal use: 0.8 to 1.6 g, baked and made into pill or powder form. External use as needed, sprinkle or apply as a solution.
English.Contraindications: Sometimes taken internally may cause vomiting, diarrhea, dizziness. Not to be used by those with bleeding ulcer within the past 3 months. Not to be taken by pregnant women. While taking this herb, do not use tea. Large dosage can cause death.
English.Notes: The color of zao fan is green or greenish black crystal. It was originally used for dyeing black, hence the name. After heating, it becomes Fe2O3, which is a very fine powder with very active characteristics.

Botanical: F. unibracteata Hsiao et K. C. Hsiao
Fritillaria verticillata Willd. var. Fritillaria thunbergii Bak.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：3至10克。粉剂（混入水中）：1至2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 脾虚、寒、湿痰和寒咳者忌用。生貝母有毒，不可内服。
Chinese.Research: 少量的甾苷可使狗、猫和兔子的血压升高，而大量则可使血压降低。注射7.5 ml/kg的贝母苷给兔子会增加血糖，并且能够维持超过2小时。抗生素效果。
Chinese.Notes: 川貝母适合治疗损伤阴的慢性咳嗽，以及无痰的干咳。浙貝母偏寒，其泻下能力更强。

Pharmaceutical: chuan bei mu: Bulbus Fritillariae Cirrhosae
zhe bei mu: Bulbus Fritillariae Thunbergii
Botanical: F. unibracteata Hsiao et K. C. Hsiao
Fritillaria verticillata Willd. var. Fritillaria thunbergii Bak.

English.Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 10 g. As powder form (mixed in water): 1 to 2 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to use by those with spleen deficiency, cold, with wet phlegm and cold cough. Raw bei mu is toxic and not for internal use.
English.Research: Small amounts of the saponin can raise blood pressure of dogs, cats, and rabbits while large amounts can lower it. Injection of 7.5 ml/kg peimine to rabbits increased blood sugar and it was able to maintain it for more than 2 hours. Antibiotic effect.
English.Notes: Chuan bei mu is good for chronic cough that injured yin, and dry cough without phlegm. Zhe bei mu is colder and its purging ability is stronger.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：3至9克。也可以制成丸剂或粉末形式。外用：粉末或水提取液或蒸馏液，用于鼻用滴剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚火旺者忌用。
Chinese.Research: 精油具有抗炎作用：它可以降低血管通透性，抑制免疫球蛋白E诱导的肿胀，减轻弗洛伊德佐剂诱导的关节炎，还可以抑制慢性炎症的增生。

English.Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 9 grams. It is also made into pills or into powder form. For external use: powder for or water extract or distilled, for nose drop.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yinxu with fire.
English.Research: The essential oil possesses anti-inflammatory effect: it can lower the permeability of blood vessels, inhibit immunoglobulin E induced swelling, lessens Freud's adjuvant induced arthritis, also can inhibit chronic inflammation hyperplasia.

Chinese.Contraindications: 孕期禁止使用。在脾虚的情况下使用时请谨慎。
Chinese.Notes: 配方的样本：訶子散。

English.Contraindications: Not to use in case of pregnancy. Use caution in cases of spleen deficiency.
English.Notes: Samples of formulae: he zi san 訶子散.

Chinese.Preparation: 整株草药或种子：3到9克。外用：用于煎汤时适量使用。清洗或蒸煮受影响的身体部位。
Chinese.Contraindications: 由于对眼睛有害，不要大量使用或长期使用。麻疹已成熟时避免使用。气虚、脚气、严重口臭、体臭、烂牙或牙龈疾病的情况下不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 芫荽富含香菜醇，有助于抵抗乳腺癌和肝癌。在动物研究中，香菜醇阻止致癌霉菌黄曲霉毒素与引发肝癌的DNA结合。芫荽有助于排出体内的汞。
Chinese.Notes: 在一些文献中提到，长期使用可能导致健忘，不应与某些草药一起食用。

English.Preparation: Whole herb or seeds: 3 to 9 g. External use: use appropriate amount for making decoction. Wash or steam the affected parts of the body.
English.Contraindications: Do not use large amount or for prolonged use due to harmful effects on the eyes. Avoid when measles has ripened. Not to use in cases of qi deficiency, beriberi, serious bad breath, body odor, rotten teeth, or gum disease.
English.Research: Yuan sui is rich in coriandrol, which helps combat breast and liver cancers. In animal studies, coriandrol stopped the cancer-causing mold aflatoxin from binding to DNA that triggers liver cancer. Yuan sui helps expel mercury from the body.
English.Notes: In some texts, it is mentioned that prolonged use may cause forgetfulness and it should not be consumed with certain herbs.

Maladies Treated: 因瘀血和疼痛的身体伤害
Chinese.Preparation: 劑量：0.5克至2克。可根据症状用于各种制剂，如煎剂或粉末。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在出血、月经量过多、溃疡、怀孕或服用血液稀释药物（如华法林或肝素）期间不应使用。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明它可以阻止血小板凝结，轻微刺激心脏，并在缺氧的情况下提供大脑保护。
Chinese.Notes: 藏红花（番红花）与红花的用途相似，但效用更强，具有清凉的特性。

Maladies Treated: Enlargement of the liver and spleen
Physical injuries with blood stasis and pain
English.Preparation: Dosage: 0.5 g to 2 g. Can be used in various formulations such as decoctions or powders depending on the symptoms.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of bleeding, heavy menses, ulcers, pregnancy, or during taking blood thinning drugs like warfarin or heparin.
English.Research: Studies show it can prevent platelet coagulation, mildly stimulate the heart, and provide protection for the brain in case of oxygen deprivation.
English.Notes: Zang hong hua (fan hong fa) has similar usage as hong hua but is stronger and possesses cooling properties.

Chinese.Preparation: 桂枝：每天3-10克煎煮。肉桂：1-5克用作粉末或在煎好后加入汤剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在肝阳上亢、温热病、阴虚内热、血热呕吐时不宜使用。孕期或月经期间出血过多时使用需谨慎。过量使用可能对肾脏有毒，并导致尿路出血。过度烹煮可能降低效果。
Chinese.Research: 肉桂醛具有解热作用，促进出汗，扩张皮肤血管，抗痉挛，缓解疼痛，抑制中枢神经系统，促进胆汁分泌，并具有抗生素效果。
Chinese.Notes: 桂枝来自肉桂树的嫩枝，而肉桂则是树的厚树皮。一般来说，肉桂用于补药，桂枝用于祛风湿，但它们可以互换使用。
Chemical Ingredients: 甲基羟基查尔酮聚合物

Maladies Treated: impotence due to kidney yang deficiency
English.Preparation: Gui zhi: 3-10 g per day for boiling. Ruo gui: 1-5 g used as powder or added to the decoction when ready.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in case of liver yang ascending, warm-febrile diseases, yin deficiency with heat, heat in blood with vomiting. Use caution during pregnancy or excessive bleeding during menses. Over dosage may be toxic to the kidney and may cause bleeding in the urinary tract. Over cooking may lessen effectiveness.
English.Research: Cinnamaldehyde possesses antipyretic effects, promotes sweating, dilates blood vessels of the skin, anti-spasm, relieves pain, inhibits CNS, promotes bile secretion, and has antibiotic effects.
English.Notes: Gui zhi is from the young branches of cinnamon trees while rou gui is the thick bark of the trees. Generally, rou gui is used in tonics and gui zhi for expelling wind and dampness but they can be used interchangeably.

Chinese.Preparation: 用水煮沸並製成糊狀。加入精製蜂蜜作為防腐劑。用量：每天早晚各服用約10到20湯匙，配飲用水。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不應用於因虛寒引起的腹瀉和體液滯留的情況。有一些古老的著作提到它與款冬花、苦參和白木耳不相容。
Chinese.Research: 麥門冬的根含有多種葡萄糖苷，對循環系統產生影響，如改善心肌收縮、保護心肌、抗心律不齊和抗菌性質。在動物測試中未顯示出毒性。

English.Preparation: Cook with water and render into paste. Add refined honey as preservative. Dosage: Take about 10 to 20 tablespoonfuls with drinking water every morning and evening.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in cases of diarrhea due to cold from deficiency and fluid retention. Some old writings mentioned it is not compatible with kuan dong hua, ku shen, and bai mu er.
English.Research: The root of mai dong contains many kinds of glucosides, showing effects on the circulatory system such as improving contraction of heart muscles, protecting heart muscle, anti-arrhythmia, and anti-bacterial properties. It did not show toxicity in animal tests.

Chinese.Preparation: 对于慢性腹泻：老鸛草18克，红枣4枚。煎成浓汤，每天使用3次。对于肌肉瘫痪：将老鸛草、君菊草和舒筋草与肉一起炖，作为汤使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 毒性信息包括研究指出的潜在警告，特别是在与天然抗氧化剂相关的研究中注意到。
Chinese.Research: 它富含天然抗氧化剂的潜在来源。

English.Preparation: For chronic diarrhea: lao guan cao 18 g, hong zao 4 pieces. Make into thick decoction. Use as 3 servings per day. For muscle paralysis: lao guan cao, jun gu cao, and shu jin cao with meat make into stew use as soup.
English.Contraindications: Toxicity information includes research indicating potential caution, particularly noted in studies related to natural antioxidants.
English.Research: It is rich in potential sources of natural antioxidants.

Maladies Treated: 由于子宫未回位引起的疼痛
Chinese.Preparation: 种子：12-18 克。 花蕾：3-6 克。 花蕾用于煎剂。 种子用于煎剂、丸剂或粉剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不要过量使用。 长期使用可能导致无动机综合症。 戒断症状包括厌食症、失眠、焦虑和抑郁。 孕期吸烟可能导致流产或低体重胎儿。
Chinese.Research: 花蕾具有镇痛特性。
Chinese.Notes: 长期使用可能导致体重增加。

Maladies Treated: Pain caused by uterus not getting back in place
English.Preparation: Seeds: 12-18 gm. Buds: 3-6 gm. Buds are used in decoction. Seeds are used in decoction, pill, or powder form.
English.Contraindications: Do not overdose. Chronic usage can cause Amotivational syndrome. Withdrawal symptoms can include anorexia, insomnia, anxiety, and depression. Smoking during pregnancy may cause miscarriage or underweight fetus.
English.Research: The buds possess analgesic qualities.
English.Notes: Long-term usage can cause weight gain.

Botanical: 牛膝根 蒿 (Bupleurum chinense DC.)

Chinese.Preparation: 3到12克，可以通过酒或醋炒制以减少寒性。
Chinese.Contraindications: 轻度毒性。阴虚咳嗽或因肝火上升引起的头痛不宜使用。过量可能导致头痛、头晕、呕吐和胃肠炎。
Chinese.Research: 对中枢神经系统有镇静作用，具有镇痛、抗炎以及对免疫、消化和心血管系统的作用。
Chinese.Notes: 各种制备方法增强不同的治疗特性。

Maladies Treated: Fullness in chest and rib cage
English.Preparation: 3 to 12 g, can be prepared by stir-frying with wine or vinegar to reduce cold properties.
English.Contraindications: Mildly toxic. Not for use in cases of yin deficiency cough or headache due to ascending liver fire. Overdose can lead to headaches, dizziness, vomiting, and gastroenteritis.
English.Research: Has calming effects on the CNS, pain-relieving, anti-inflammatory, and effects on the immune, digestive, cardiovascular systems.
English.Notes: Various preparation methods enhance different therapeutic properties.

Botanical: Erythrina variegata L. var. orientalis (L.) MERR.

Chinese.Preparation: 6至12克。外用适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 血虚者禁用。

Botanical: Erythrina variegata L. var. orientalis (L.) MERR.

English.Preparation: 6 to 12 g. Use appropriate amount for external application.
English.Contraindications: not to use in cases of Blood deficient.

Chinese.Preparation: 5到10克。新鲜草药：10到20克。不要煮太久，否则可能会失去有效成分的精油。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚有热及胃火者忌用。
Chinese.Research: 藿香的煎剂对许多病原真菌和钩端螺旋体具有体外抗生素效果。
Chinese.Notes: 参见妊娠呕吐方 #2 藿香正气散。

English.Preparation: 5 to 10 g. Fresh herb: 10 to 20 g. Do not boil too long or may lose the effective ingredients of essential oil.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in yinxu (yin deficient) with heat and stomach fire.
English.Research: The decoction of huo xiang possesses antibiotic effect in vitro on many pathogenic fungi and leptospirosis.
English.Notes: See pregnancy nausea formula #2 huo xiang zheng qi san.

Chinese.Preparation: 1克或更少。治疗麻风：研磨成粉。与米胶捏成与黑胡椒大小相同的丸剂。空腹时一次服用15颗，配茶。每日3次。
Chinese.Contraindications: 肌肉注射可能导致坏死。静脉或皮下注射可能引起溶血性贫血、血尿和蛋白尿。此药草非常有毒，主要用于外用。如需口服，应该在方剂中稀释。不可过量或长期使用。阴虚体质、胃肠炎或眼疾患者不应使用此药草。
Chinese.Research: 应长时间烹煮以去除油脂以防毒性。大剂量及长期使用可能导致失明。副作用包括头晕、头痛、胸痛、发热、虚弱、失眠和食欲减退。
Chinese.Notes: 已记录其毒性；必须确保正确准备以减少危害。

English.Preparation: 1 g or less. For treatment of leprosy: Grind into powder. Make into pills with rice glue, into the size of black pepper. Take 15 pills each time with tea on empty stomach. Take 3 times per day.
English.Contraindications: Intra-muscular injection can lead to necrosis. Intravenous or subcutaneous injection can cause hemolytic anemia, hematuria, and proteinuria. This herb is very toxic. It is mainly for external use. If it is to be taken orally, it should be diluted in the formula. Do not overdose or use for long periods. Patients with yinxu (yin deficient) condition, gastro-enteritis, or eye diseases should not use this herb.
English.Research: Should be cooked for a long time to get rid of the oil to prevent toxicity. Large dosage and long term usage can cause blindness. Side effects include dizziness, headache, chest pain, fever, weakness, insomnia, and loss of appetite.
English.Notes: Toxicity has been noted; must ensure proper preparation to reduce hazards.

Chinese.Preparation: 粉末形式：12-15克；（相当于720-900毫克的水飞蓟素）。由于水飞蓟素的有效成分在水中的溶解度非常低，因此煎煮效果不好。
Chinese.Contraindications: 可能导致恶心、腹泻、腹部胀气和疼痛，并可能引起过敏反应（特别是对同一家族植物过敏的人， 如豚草、菊花、万寿菊和菊苣）。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明它在改善肝功能和降低因肝炎而导致的慢性饮酒者的AST和ALT值方面具有潜力。

English.Preparation: In powder form: 12–15 g; (equivalent to 720–900 mg of silymarin). Not effective in decoction since the effective ingredient of silymarin has a very low water solubility.
English.Contraindications: It may cause nausea, diarrhea, abdominal bloating, and pain, and it can produce allergic reactions (especially who are allergic to plants in the same family, such as ragweed, chrysanthemum, marigold, and daisy).
English.Research: Modern research shows its potential in improving liver function and lowering the AST and ALT values in chronic alcohol drinkers caused by hepatitis.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量因病情而异，从30克到90克。通常制备为汤剂或粉末。对于某些病症，建议制作两次汤剂或与鸡蛋或其他草药混合。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适用于气虚和血虚患者或孕妇。大剂量和/或长期使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Research: 多项研究表明在治疗结石和炎症等病症方面的有效性。在某些情况下，总有效性可达到98.1%。
Chinese.Notes: 该草药通常与其他草药一起使用以增强疗效。大剂量可能导致毒性。

Maladies Treated: Inflammation of the glands of children
English.Preparation: Dosages vary from 30g to 90g depending on the condition. Commonly prepared as a decoction or powder. For some conditions, it is advised to make two servings of decoction or to mix with eggs or other herbs.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in cases of qi deficiency and blood deficiency or during pregnancy. Large dosages and/or long-term usage can be toxic to kidneys.
English.Research: Various studies indicate effectiveness in treating conditions such as calculus and inflammation. Total effectiveness reached up to 98.1% in certain cases.
English.Notes: The herb is traditionally used alongside other herbs for greater efficacy. High dosage can lead to toxicity.

Chinese.Preparation: 用沙子炒制并研磨成细粉。急用时，将5克粉末溶解在热水中。如果使用大剂量，需先煮沸草药以减少毒性。
Chinese.Contraindications: 这是一种非常有毒的草药，尤其是生用时。如果症候不是寒凉和虚弱，不要使用。生吃可能致命。妊娠期间或与某些其他草药一起使用时不得使用。
Chinese.Research: 在大鼠中，巴豆苷的急性口服毒性被芍药苷显著降低。
Chinese.Notes: 选择加工得当的附子非常重要，因为许多快速加工方法会降低其有效性。白附子和川乌常被混淆；白附子与另一种植物相关，效果不同。

Maladies Treated: Pain and cold in chest and abdomen
Chronic diarrhea due to spleen deficiency
Edema and coldness in lower legs
English.Preparation: Prepare by frying with sand and grinding into fine powder. For urgent cases, dissolve 5g of the powder in hot water. If large dosages are used, boil the herb first to reduce toxicity.
English.Contraindications: This is a very toxic herb, especially in raw form. Do not use if syndrome is not cold and weak. Ingesting it in raw form can be fatal. Not to be used during pregnancy or with certain other herbs.
English.Research: The acute oral toxicity of aconitine in rats was significantly reduced by paeoniflorin.
English.Notes: It is important to choose well-processed fu zi, as many rapid processing methods can reduce its effectiveness. Bai fu zi and chuan fu zi are often confused; bai fu zi is associated with another plant and does not have the same effects.

Chinese.Preparation: 10到25克（不宜長時間煮）。外用依需要使用10-25克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 新鮮魚腥草汁液抑制金黃色葡萄球菌；加熱後效果減弱。陰道應用有潛在輕微毒性，可能引起炎症。注射報告有過敏反應、休克和皮膚萎縮的情況。
Chinese.Research: 體外研究表明，精油可抑制HIV-1。其成分包括鉀鹽和槲皮素，可增強毛細血管功能並改善血液循環。
Chinese.Notes: 含揮發油；不適合長時間煮沸。

English.Preparation: 10 to 25 g (do not boil for a long time). External use according to need 10-25 g.
English.Contraindications: Juice from fresh yu xing cao inhibits staphylococcus aureus; less effective after heating. Potential mild toxicity with vaginal applications causing inflammation. Reports of allergic reactions, shock, and skin atrophy from injections.
English.Research: In vitro studies show that the essential oil can inhibit HIV-1. Its ingredients, including potassium salt and quercetin, enhance capillary function and improve blood flow.
English.Notes: Contains volatile oil; not suitable for prolonged boiling.

Maladies Treated: 由於熱積聚引起的煩躁
Chinese.Preparation: 0.3 到 1.5 克，以丸或粉末形式。
Chinese.Contraindications: 懷孕和月經期間禁忌，直腸出血。脾虛時不宜使用。大量或長期使用可能會對腎臟造成不可逆的損害。毒性成分為大黃素和蘆薈內酯。
Chinese.Research: 有證據顯示其有多種作用，包括通便作用、愈合傷口和燒傷，對某些腫瘤的抗腫瘤作用，抗真菌作用，以及增強免疫系統。
Chinese.Notes: 包括觀賞品種如Aloe Mitriformis和Aloe Variegata。

English.Preparation: 0.3 to 1.5 g in pill or powder form.
English.Contraindications: Contraindication during pregnancies and menstrual periods, rectal bleeding. Not to use in case of pixu (spleen deficient). Large amount or long term usage may cause irreversible damage to the kidneys. The toxic ingredients are aloin and aloe-emodin.
English.Research: There is evidence of various effects including a laxative effect, healing wounds and burns, antineoplastic effect on certain tumors, antifungal effect, and immune system strengthening.
English.Notes: Includes ornamental varieties such as Aloe Mitriformis and Aloe Variegata.

Maladies Treated: 因感染引起的排便急迫感
因肝火造成的眼睛红肿
阴道念珠菌或细菌感染
Chinese.Contraindications: 虽然煎剂的毒性较低，但偶尔会引起恶心和呕吐。不要使用大量；大量可能引起镇静、痉挛、昏迷、呼吸停止和死亡。对于因脾虚或肾阳虚导致的慢性腹泻不宜使用，因为可能会进一步削弱身体。避免与吴茱萸同用。
Chinese.Notes: 主要用于急性肠道细菌感染。

Maladies Treated: urge of defecating caused by infection
swollen and red eyes caused by heat in liver
English.Contraindications: Although the toxicity of decoction is low, it can occasionally cause nausea and vomiting. Do not use large amounts; large amounts may cause sedation, spasms, coma, respiratory arrest, and death. Not to be used in chronic diarrhea caused by spleen deficiency or kidney yang deficiency as it may weaken the body further. Avoid use with wu zhu yu.
English.Notes: Mainly used in acute bacterial infections of the intestine.

Chinese.Preparation: 每餐100克到200克；种子用于煎煮：6~12克；可以制成粉末或药丸。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适合阴虚者；过量可能刺激肠道并引起腹泻，尤其是在饮酒后。
Chinese.Research: 该植物含有硫化物，帮助吸收维生素A和B1。它可以促进血管扩张并降低血压。韭菜提取物在体外抑制癌细胞生长并诱导凋亡。
Chinese.Notes: 含有高水平的草酸；对于有代谢问题（如糖尿病）的人可能导致肾结石。

English.Preparation: 100 g to 200 g per meal; Seeds used in decoction: 6~12 g; can be made into powder or pills.
English.Contraindications: Not suitable for those who are yin deficient; excessive amounts can irritate the intestines and cause diarrhea, especially after drinking alcohol.
English.Research: The plant contains sulfur compounds that help absorb vitamins A and B1. It can promote vasodilation and lower blood pressure. Jiu cai extract inhibited cancer cell growth and induced apoptosis in vitro.
English.Notes: Contains high levels of oxalic acid; may lead to kidney stones in people with metabolic problems such as diabetes.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服。用于煎剂 5 - 10 克。或作为茶叶使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 长期使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Research: 罗布麻提取物诱导的血管舒张是内皮依赖的，并由内皮衍生的超极化因子介导，涉及K(+)-通道的激活。高浓度的罗布麻提取物可能增强一氧化氮的生成/释放，导致血管舒张。

English.Preparation: Take orally. For decoction 5 - 10 g. Or use as tea leaves.
English.Contraindications: Long term usage may be toxic to kidneys.
English.Research: Vasodilation induced by luo bu ma extract is endothelium-dependent and mediated by endothelium-derived hyperpolarizing factor, which involves the activation of K(+)-channels. The higher concentrations of luo bu ma extract may enhance NO production/release to cause vasodilation.

Chinese.Preparation: 内服：煎剂：9到12克，也可以制成丸剂或粉剂。外用：涂抹于受影响区域。
Chinese.Contraindications: 与元胡和大黄不相容。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明，它可以附着于消化道中的毒素和发酵产生的异常物质。
Chinese.Notes: 它对发炎的胃黏膜具有局部保护作用，并对控制胃肠出血有影响。

Maladies Treated: Heavy bleeding in the vagina not during menses
English.Preparation: Internal use: in decoction: 9 to 12 g, also can be put into pills or powder form. External use: apply to affected areas.
English.Contraindications: Not compatible with yuan hua and da huang.
English.Research: Modern research indicates that it can attach to toxic substances and abnormal substances from fermentation in the digestive tract.
English.Notes: It has a local protective effect on inflamed gastric mucosa and effects on controlling gastrointestinal bleeding.

Chinese.Preparation: 使用新鮮的紫花地丁榨汁內服。與少量雄黃混合，捣碎外用。对于红眼，将其与菊花和蟬蛻混合煎煮，作为茶水使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在脾虛的情況下不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 紫花地丁的提取物可以在非毒性浓度下抑制多种细菌和HIV的生长。

English.Preparation: Use fresh zi hua di ding to make juice and take internally. Combine with a small amount of xiong huang, smash and apply externally. For red eyes, combine with ju hua and chan tui to make a decoction and use as tea.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient).
English.Research: The extract of zi hua di ding can inhibit the growth of various bacteria and HIV at non-toxic concentrations.

Chinese.Preparation: 将马齿苋和青黛一起磨碎，外用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适用于肝功能异常的情况。靛毓可能对肝脏有毒。应从少量开始，并定期监测肝功能。在没有阴虚(阴虚)实际热的情况下应谨慎使用。大部分在台湾地区的药材店出售的青黛主要是色素，并不含任何有效成分。
Chinese.Research: 抑制炭疽、克雷白氏肺炎、志贺氏痢疾、金黄色葡萄球菌，具有抗炎特性，通过降低白细胞计数和改善骨髓功能来改善慢性髓性白血病的症状。
Chinese.Notes: 虽然靛毓和靛蓝的化学式相同，但结构不同；靛蓝没有抗癌特性，而靛毓的结构值得进一步研究。

Maladies Treated: boils in the mouth or tongue
inflammation of the roots of teeth
cough with heat in the lungs
English.Preparation: Grind ma chi xian and qing dai together. Apply externally.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of abnormal liver function. Indirubin can be toxic to the liver. Start from a small amount and monitor liver function regularly. Use care in cases without yinxu (yin deficient) condition with real heat. Most of the herb qing dai sold in the herb stores in Taiwan area are mainly pigments and do not contain any effective ingredient.
English.Research: Inhibits anthrax, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Shigella dysenteriae, Staphylococcus aureus, shows anti-inflammatory properties, improves symptoms of chronic myelogenous leukemia by lowering white cell count and improving bone marrow function.
English.Notes: Although the chemical formulae of indirubin and indigotin are the same, the structures are different; indigotin does not possess the anti-cancer characteristics, while the structure of indirubin deserves further study.

Maladies Treated: 酵母感染导致的阴道分泌物
Chinese.Preparation: 传统上使用种子。现在叶子也被用于制作提取物。银杏叶提取物的主要用途是心血管治疗。用于口服时，将银杏的根与冰糖水煮沸，每周服用4-5剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 生银杏坚果是有毒的。过量食用会导致呕吐、腹痛、腹泻、肌肉痉挛、焦虑和呼吸困难。果实的外皮含有银杏毒素。
Chinese.Research: 平均治疗时间为133天，使用银杏提取物治疗各种疾病的患者。有些古典医学文献提到与银杏坚果消费相关的致死病例，因其毒性。
Chinese.Notes: 银杏树不耐高温或极端寒冷。尽管在中国有超过20个省份发现，但许多地方不结果实。它在广西桂林等地区生长良好。

English.Preparation: Traditionally, seeds were used. Now leaves are also being used for making extracts. The main usage of the ginkgo leaf extract is in cardiovascular therapy. For oral consumption, boil root of ginkgo biloba and rock cane sugar with water, taken 4-5 doses a week.
English.Contraindications: Raw ginkgo nuts are toxic. Over consuming can cause vomiting, pain in the abdomen, diarrhea, muscle spasm, anxiety, and difficulty in breathing. The outer skin of the fruit contains ginkgo toxin.
English.Research: The average treatment time was 133 days for patients treated with ginkgo extracts for various conditions. Some classical medical literature reported fatalities linked to ginkgo nut consumption due to toxicity.
English.Notes: Ginkgo trees do not tolerate high heat or extreme cold. Despite being found in more than twenty provinces in China, many do not bear fruits. It grows well in regions like Guilin, Guangxi province.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：3到10克。外用：适量。磨成粉末制成膏状，涂抹于患处。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适用于肺虚引起的慢性咳嗽，或阴虚或胃热的情况。大量服用可能引起腹泻。外用时间过长可能引起炎症。避免接触眼睛。

Maladies Treated: Cold phlegm obstruction type of cough
Pain and fullness in rib cage
Asthmatic cough with abundance of phlegm
English.Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 10 g. External application: use appropriate amount. Grind into powder and make paste. Apply to affect areas.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of chronic cough due to lung deficient, or yinxu (yin deficient) or heat in stomach. Taking large amount may cause diarrhea. External application for too long can cause inflammation. Avoid eye contact.

Botanical: 續斷, C. Y. Cheng et TM Ai

Maladies Treated: 腰部和膝蓋的慢性疼痛
重陰道出血（非月經期間）
Chinese.Preparation: 10到20克，濃縮提取物：0.5到2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在陰虛火弱的情況下小心使用此藥草。有報導提到一些患者出現皮疹和瘙癢。
Chinese.Research: 抑制和逆轉骨質疏鬆，促進受傷骨骼的癒合，緩解子宮的收縮，從而安胎，改善免疫系統，抑制肺炎雙球菌，保護免於缺乏維生素E，殺死陰道滴蟲，幫助子宮生長和發育。
Chinese.Notes: 穩定妊娠：固腎安胎飲（防流產：固腎安胎飲）。

Botanical: Dipsacus asperoides, C. Y.Cheng et TM Ai

Maladies Treated: Chronic pain in loin and knees
English.Preparation: 10 to 20 g, Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
Geography: Middle and southern parts of China
English.Contraindications: Use the herb carefully in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with deficient Fire. There are reports mentioning that some patients had developed rash and itchiness.
English.Research: Inhibits and reverses osteoporosis, promotes healing of injured bones, alleviates the contraction of the uterus, thus calming the fetus, improves immune system, inhibits diplococcus pneumoniae, protects from lacking of vitamin E, kills Trichomoniasis, helps uterus to grow and develop.
English.Notes: For stabilizing pregnancy: gu shen an tai yin (防流產：固腎安胎飲).

Chinese.Preparation: 每日10克至30克，煮水服用。生地黄汁可用于开放性创伤。
Chinese.Contraindications: 使用大剂量时需谨慎。大剂量已显示对心脏有毒，尤其是在青蛙中。生地黄不应在虚弱伴湿的情况下使用，也不应在阳虚、以及孕妇伴有虚弱或胃虚的血虚情况下使用。熟地黄毒性较小，但副作用可能包括腹泻、腹痛、头晕、虚弱和心悸。
Chinese.Research: 用热水提取的枸杞和地黄的治疗可以保护肝损伤大鼠免受坏死性损伤。临床报道表明地黄与甘草结合可促进肝功能恢复。
Chinese.Notes: 生地黄是通过干燥制备的，而熟地黄则是通过与其他草药蒸煮制备的。

English.Preparation: 10 grams to 30 grams per day, boiled with water. Raw sheng di huang juice can be used on open wounds.
English.Contraindications: Use caution when using large dosages. Large doses have shown to be toxic for the heart, especially in frogs. Sheng di huang should not be used in cases of pixu with dampness, or in cases of yangxu, and in pregnant women with blood deficiency of pixu or weixu. Shu di huang is less toxic, but side effects can include diarrhea, abdominal pain, dizziness, weakness, and palpitations.
English.Research: Treatment with hot water extracted Lycium barbarum and Rehmannia glutinosa protects against necrotic damage in rats with liver injury. Clinical reports indicate that di huang combined with gan cao promotes recovery of liver function.
English.Notes: Sheng di huang is prepared by drying, while shu di huang is prepared by steaming with other herbs.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：粉末形式，0.7至2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不宜用於胃寒或濕痰的情況。警告：市場上有假馬寶。
Chinese.Research: 對真馬結石和假馬寶的成分進行了分析。真馬寶的主要成分是NH4MgPO4.6H2O, NH4MgPO4.H2O，而假馬寶的主要成分是CaCO3。
Chinese.Notes: 馬寶是一種珍貴的中藥材，具有鎮靜、化痰和解毒的作用。

English.Preparation: To take orally: in powder form, 0.7 to 2 g.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of cold stomach or in damp phlegm. Warning: there are fake ma bao in the market.
English.Research: Components of the genuine calculus Equi and false ma bao were analyzed. The main components of the genuine ma bao are NH4MgPO4.6H2O, NH4MgPO4.H2O, whereas the main components of the false ma bao are CaCO3.
English.Notes: Ma bao is a valuable Chinese medicinal material, with sedative, phlegm-transforming, and detoxifying effects.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服；煎剂3-9克，或制成粉末或汁液。外用：适量，捣碎后外敷。
Chinese.Contraindications: 我们尚未找到任何信息。
Chinese.Research: 62.5毫克每毫升的扁豆花煎剂可以抑制志贺氏菌和弗莱克斯纳氏杆菌的生长。
Chinese.Notes: 白崩：是一个传统中医术语，描述阴道频繁大量分泌白色分泌物。火制盐是指通过火焰制造的盐。

English.Preparation: Take orally; in decoction 3-9 g, or make into powder or juice. External application: appropriate amount, smash and apply.
English.Contraindications: We have not found any information yet.
English.Research: Invitro of 62.5mg per ml of bian dou huo decoction can inhibit the growth of Shigella sonnei and Flexner's bacillus.
English.Notes: Bai beng: is a traditional Chinese medical term describing frequent large amounts of vaginal white color discharge. Fire rendered salt refers to salt produced by using fire.

Chinese.Preparation: 甘蔗梢应在冬季保存时保持绿色，以保持其营养成分。可以直接食用或作为动物饲料使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 避免使用已经枯萎的甘蔗梢，因为营养成分可能会被破坏。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明甘蔗梢具有帮助清热、滋润燥邪、止咳和化痰的特性。
Chinese.Notes: 良好的储存方法是确保缺氧条件以保持新鲜和营养。

English.Preparation: The tips of sugar cane should be stored in winter while still green to preserve their nutrients. They can be taken directly or used in feed for animals.
English.Contraindications: Avoid use if the tips are wilted, as nutrients may be destroyed.
English.Research: Studies show that gan zhe shao has properties that help relieve heat, moisten dryness, stop cough, and clear phlegm.
English.Notes: A good practice for storage is to ensure anaerobic conditions to maintain freshness and nutrients.

Chinese.Preparation: 用量：10至20克。浓缩提取物0.5~2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 对于有阴虚火旺症状的人需谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 鸡血藤煎剂已显示改善贫血和具有抗炎作用；增强巨噬细胞功能并抑制血小板凝聚。
Chinese.Notes: 用于多种与血液相关的状况；可与具有补血和补气属性的草药结合使用。

English.Preparation: Dosage: 10 to 20 g. Concentrate extract 0.5 ~ 2 g.
English.Contraindications: Use with care for those with yinxu with fire syndrome.
English.Research: Decoction of Millettia Dielsiana has shown to improve anemia and possesses anti-inflammatory effects; enhances macrophage function and inhibits platelet coagulation.
English.Notes: Administrative use for various blood-related conditions; combines with herbs that have blood and qi tonic properties.

Maladies Treated: 类风湿性关节炎的疼痛
Chinese.Preparation: 3到12克；可以煎汤服用或外用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 如果患者体虚，应谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 徐长青的乙醇提取物在实验鼠的单纯疱疹病毒脑炎后显示出对神经元细胞凋亡的预防作用。
Chinese.Notes: 常用于止痛、止痒、消肿和解毒。也可用于蛇咬相关的治疗。

English.Preparation: 3 to 12 grams; can be taken as a decoction or applied externally.
English.Contraindications: Use with care if the patient is weak.
English.Research: Ethanol extract of xu chang qing has shown preventative effects on apoptosis in neuron cells post herpes simplex virus encephalitis in lab mice.
English.Notes: Commonly used for arresting pain, stopping itching, reducing swelling, and detoxification. Can also be used in for treatments related to snake bites.

Chinese.Preparation: 劑量：每日內服 15 至 30 克。外用時，使用適量，將新鮮草藥捣烂，塗抹於患處。煎煮的例子包括使用乾燥的鐵莧菜 30 至 60 克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕婦禁用。對於年老或虛弱並有氣虛的人應謹慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 在體外，鐵莧菜的煎劑對幾種常見的志賀氏菌，特別是志賀痢疾桿菌具有抗生素效果，對金黃色葡萄球菌和霍亂弧菌也有活性。
Chinese.Notes: 根據不同的植物部分和細菌類型觀察到不同的抗菌效果。

English.Preparation: Dosage: 15 to 30 g daily for internal use. For external use, use an appropriate amount, smash fresh herb, and apply to the affected area. Example preparation for decoction includes using dried tie xian cai 30 to 60 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use during pregnancy. Use with caution in those who are old or weak with Qi deficiency.
English.Research: In vitro, tie xian cai decoction exhibits antibiotic effects against several common Shigella bacteria, especially Shigella dysenteriae, with noted activity against Staphylococcus aureus and Vibrio cholerae as well.
English.Notes: Differential antibacterial effects are observed based on different plant parts and the type of bacteria.

Chinese.Preparation: 内服：煎剂，15 ~ 30克，新鲜药材60 ~ 120克；或榨汁混合蜂蜜内服，或制成汁液漱口。外用：适量，洗净，捣碎后外敷或洗净患处，或日晒后制成粉末制成敷料或外用软膏或乳霜敷于患处。
Chinese.Contraindications: 某些斑兰科植物的叶子已知含有草酸钙晶体。对肾功能减退者可能有害。
Chinese.Research: P. amaryllifolius含有对人类病毒具有抗性的凝集素，如：单纯疱疹病毒1型（HSV-1）、流感病毒（H1N1）。P. amaryllifolius的乙醇提取物在体外诱导激素独立型乳腺癌细胞系MDA-MB-231的细胞凋亡。叶提取物可以显著减缓油的氧化和变质。
Chinese.Notes: 现代研究表明，noni果可能有肝毒性，一些个体对肝毒性反应敏感。
Chemical Ingredients: 非特异性脂质转移蛋白

English.Preparation: For oral consumption: decoction, 15 ~ 30g, Fresh herb 60 ~ 120g; or squeeze for juice and mix with honey and take orally or make into juice and gargle. External use: appropriate amount, wash, smash and apply topically or washed affected areas or sun dried and make into powder and make into dressing or topical ointment or cream for applying to affected areas.
English.Contraindications: The leaves of some Pandanus species are known to contain calcium oxalate crystals. It may be harmful to those with decreased kidney function.
English.Research: P. amaryllifolius contains lectin with anti-human viruses like: herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1), influenza virus (H1N1). P. amaryllifolius ethanol extract in vitro induced apoptosis on hormone independent breast cancer cell line MDA-MB-231. The leaf extract can significantly retarded oil oxidation and deterioration.
English.Notes: Modern research suggests possible liver toxicity from noni fruit, with some individuals having sensitivity to hepatotoxic effects.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量通常为6到15克。可根据病情生用、炒制、酒制或醋制。
Chinese.Contraindications: 产后不要使用赤芍。生用白芍不应在脾虚引起的腹痛或腹泻时使用。应改用炒白芍。
Chinese.Research: 白芍甙显著降低了大鼠中毒生物碱的急性口服毒性。各种研究表明，白芍甙可以缓解行为和认知障碍，并可能具有抗抑郁作用。
Chinese.Notes: 白芍常用于血瘀，并具有轻微的镇痛特性。赤芍药在消除血瘀方面效果较强，常用于外伤和血块。

English.Preparation: Dosage is typically 6 to 15 grams. Can be used raw, stir-fried, wine-treated, or vinegar-treated depending on the condition.
English.Contraindications: Do not use chi shao after giving birth. Raw bai shao should not be used in case of abdominal pain or diarrhea due to spleen deficiency. Use chao bai shao instead.
English.Research: The acute oral toxicity of aconitine in rats was significantly reduced by paeoniflorin. Various studies suggest that paeoniflorin can alleviate behavioral and cognitive impairments and may have antidepressant effects.
English.Notes: Bai shao is commonly used for addressing blood stasis and has mild analgesic properties. Chi shao yao has stronger effects on removing blood stasis and is used in injuries and blood clots.

Maladies Treated: 阴虚伴有午后潮热和夜间盗汗
Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量为10至20克；浓缩提取物为0.5至2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: spleen deficiency引起的腹泻时禁用。对易出血者应谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究结果发表于《军事医学杂志》，2006年第4期。

Maladies Treated: Yin deficient with afternoon fever and night sweating
Toothache due to heat in stomach
Cough due to heat in the lung
English.Preparation: Daily dosage is 10 to 20 g; concentrated extract is 0.5 to 2 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of diarrhea due to spleen deficiency. Use with care for those who are prone to bleeding.
English.Research: Modern research findings mentioned in Military Medical Journal, 2006, issue 4.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：12克至18克。由于含有活性成分精油，不要长时间煮沸。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在脾虚/消化弱、腹泻的情况下禁用。
Chinese.Research: 锌/铜比率过高易导致冠心病。河南的怀菊花锌/铜比率较低，可能有助于预防冠心病。
Chinese.Notes: 野菊花被报告在降低胆固醇、降低血压和抑制感染方面比菊花更有效。

Maladies Treated: Pain in lower back and knees
English.Preparation: Dosage: 12 g ~ 18 g. Do not boil for a long period because it contains essential oil which is an active ingredient.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in case of pixu (spleen deficient)/weak digestion with loose stool.
English.Research: High ratio of Zn/Cu is prone to coronary heart diseases. The Huai ju hua of Henan has a lower Zn/Cu ratio which may be beneficial in preventing coronary heart diseases.
English.Notes: Wild ju hua is reported to be better than julua in lowering cholesterol, lowering blood pressure, and inhibiting infection.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服，煎剂：2到10克；或粉末或丸剂形式。外用：使用适量，捣碎后涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在咳血或咳脓的情况下须格外小心。不适用于因阴虚（yinxu）引起的慢性咳嗽。
Chinese.Research: 毒性和注意事项包括在特定情况下需小心。与紫苑同用效果良好，但与其他几种草药不相容。
Chinese.Notes: 因其各种配方而闻名，包括在某些情况下需谨慎使用的毒性成分。
Chemical Ingredients: 14-乙酰氧基-7β-[3-乙基克罗顿氧]-诺托尼平酮

Maladies Treated: Cough due to coldness in lungs
Cough due to heat in lungs
English.Preparation: Taking orally, in decoction: 2 to 10 g; or in powder or pill form. External application: use appropriate amount, smash and apply.
English.Contraindications: Use extreme care in cases of coughing out blood or pus. Not to use in cases of chronic coughing with yinxu (yin deficient) condition.
English.Research: Toxicity and cautions noted include care in specific conditions. It is beneficial to use with zi wan and incompatible with several other herbs.
English.Notes: It is known for various formulations and includes toxic components that require caution in certain conditions.

Chinese.Preparation: 常規用量煎煮：3至9克。外用：製成酒精提取物或煎煮。
Chinese.Contraindications: 有高熱無寒的情況或陰虛有熱的患者禁用。
Chemical Ingredients: (5, 6-二甲基-3a, 4, 7, 7alpha-四氫-1, 3-異苯並呋喃二酮)

English.Preparation: Normal usage in decoction: 3 to 9 g. External use: make into alcohol extract or into decoction.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of high fever without chill or in case of yinxu (yin deficient) with fever.

Maladies Treated: 因外伤引起的胸肋部疼痛
Chinese.Preparation: 鲜草药 3到9克。小儿用量应少。煎汤口服。
Geography: 东喜马拉雅 (尼泊尔，锡金)

Maladies Treated: pain in rib cage area caused by impact injury
English.Preparation: Fresh herb 3 to 9 g. Use less on small children. Make into decoction and take orally.

Maladies Treated: 因热性疾病引起的口渴
Chinese.Preparation: 剂量为10到20克。浓缩提取物：0.5到2克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 无湿热症状时不得使用。
Chinese.Research: 伞状多孔菌中ergone的含量因栖息地而异，含量范围为2.13到59.17克。

Maladies Treated: Thirst due to heat type of sickness
English.Preparation: Dosage is 10 to 20 g. Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use when there is no symptoms of damp-heat.
English.Research: Content of ergone in P. umbellatus varied significantly from habitat to habitat with contents ranging from 2.13 to 59.17 g.

Maladies Treated: 缓解体力劳动引起的疼痛
Chinese.Contraindications: 对有热症的患者使用要小心。

Common: a li shan wu wei zi

Maladies Treated: Ridding of ache and pain from physical exertion
English.Preparation: 1.5–8 g per day
English.Contraindications: Use with care in patients with excess heat.

Botanical: Leonurus sibiricus LF albiflora (Nakai & Kitagawa) G. Y. Wu et H. W. Li

Maladies Treated: 产后腹痛伴有恶露不尽
Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：9 ~ 30 克。长期或大剂量使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Contraindications: 血虚及无血瘀或孕期不宜使用。长期使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Notes: 茺蔚子（Chong wei zi）是植物的种子，味甘且微寒。可用作植物，并可用于清肝。

Botanical: Leonurus sibiricus LF albiflora (Nakai & Kitagawa) G. Y. Wu et H. W. Li

English.Preparation: Dosage: 9 ~ 30 g. Long-term or large dosages can be toxic to the kidneys.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in case of blood deficient and in cases without blood stasis or during pregnancy. Long-term usage can be toxic to the kidneys.
English.Notes: Chong wei zi (茺蔚子) is the seeds of the plant and is sweet and slightly cold. It is being used as the plant and can be used to cool the liver.

Common: 根和根茎的须根鬼针草

Chinese.Preparation: 5-10 克，通常用于方剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不可用于气虚引起的咳嗽，且不是由感染引起的。
Chinese.Research: 毒性与注意事项：根据《本草经疏》，气虚咳嗽被禁用。
Chinese.Notes: 常与紫苑和半夏一起使用，适用于寒热型咳嗽。

English.Preparation: 5-10 grams, typically used in formulas.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cough due to qi deficiency and not due to infection.
English.Research: Toxicity & Cautions: Banned for cough due to qi deficient as per 'Ben Cao Jing Su'.
English.Notes: Often used with zi wan and ban xia, applicable for both cold and hot types of cough.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日6-12克；或在單獨使用以治療帶狀蟲時，60-120克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 氣虛者勿服。
Chinese.Notes: 用檳榔片製作1:1的眼藥水，按需使用以治療青光眼。對於腸道寄生蟲，需烘烤並研磨檳榔，按照指示使用。

English.Preparation: 6-12 g daily; or 60-120 g when used alone for treating tape worms.
English.Contraindications: not to take in cases of qi deficient.
English.Notes: For treatment of glaucoma, use betel nut pieces made into 1:1 eye drops, applied as needed. For intestinal parasites, bake and powder the nut, using as directed.

Maladies Treated: 由于血液积聚导致的子宫胀满
Chinese.Preparation: 用量为3 - 9克煎汤，3克可作粉末服用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚火旺者，及中风后虚弱典型者不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 在动物研究中显示出抗炎作用、镇痛作用和抗癫痫作用。
Chinese.Notes: 作为传统医学中治疗各种疾病的药物，包括慢性湿疹和荨麻疹。

Maladies Treated: Fullness in the uterus due to accumulation of blood
English.Preparation: Use 3 - 9 g in decoction. 3 g can be taken as powder form.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yin deficiency with heat, also in cases of weakness after stroke-like types of sickness.
English.Research: Demonstrated anti-inflammatory effects, analgesic effects, and anticonvulsant effects in animal studies.
English.Notes: Serves as a remedy in traditional medicine for various conditions including chronic eczema and urticaria.

Chinese.Preparation: 剂量：3到9克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 柿子含有鞣酸。如果与高蛋白食物如肉类或鱼类一起食用，蛋白质会被硬化并形成鞣酸白蛋白，导致消化困难。在某些个体中，可能导致便秘。体质偏寒（阳虚）的人应避免食用。过量食用可能在肠道中造成粪石，导致便秘甚至肠穿孔。
Chinese.Research: 由于柿子在西方并不常见，关于柿子的多酚的研究很少。
Chinese.Notes: 销售的干柿子表面上的白色粉末通常是在加工过程中添加的氧化钛。自然干燥过程中产生的白色粉末不易掉落。

English.Preparation: Dosage: 3 to 9 g.
English.Contraindications: Persimmons contain tannin acid. If eaten with high protein food like meat or fish, the protein can be hardened and form tannin albumate, making it difficult to digest. In some individuals, it can lead to constipation. People with a cold type of body (yang deficient) should avoid consuming them. Overconsumption can cause stercolith (fecal stones) in the intestines, leading to constipation or even gastro intestinal perforation.
English.Research: There is little research on the polyphenols of persimmon in the West because it is not a popular food item among Westerners.
English.Notes: The white powder on the surface of the dried persimmons sold are usually titanium oxide added during processing. The naturally occurring white powder during the drying process does not fall off easily.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日3 - 9克，加水煎煮。每日一剂，分成3份。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕妇及无血瘀的眼病患者需谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 在一项对200名患者的研究中，发现中药治疗白内障的总体有效率为98.4%。
Chinese.Notes: 药材的重量需根据诊断进行调整。

English.Preparation: 3 - 9 g daily, add water to make into concoction. One prescription a day, make into 3 servings.
English.Contraindications: Use with care during pregnancies and in cases of eye disease without blood stasis.
English.Research: Total effectiveness of herbal treatment for cataracts was found to be 98.4% in a study with 200 patients.
English.Notes: The weight of the herbs must be adjusted according to diagnosis.

Chinese.Preparation: 內服：10至24克煎水。適合用沙炒。如用生龜板，需在與其他藥材同用前煮沸。外用：燒焦保留性狀，磨粉後外敷於患處。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不宜用於陽虛或脾虛的情況；不宜用於尚未清除寒/流感感染的情況；孕期使用需謹慎；不宜用於無熱的虛弱患者。本草寒性，能降低陽氣。
Chinese.Research: 現代研究顯示該草藥改善抗癌能力的功能。
Chinese.Notes: 龜板膠比龜板更集中和更強烈。它是經過長時間煮龜殼而獲得的明膠。

Maladies Treated: chronic ache in loin and knees
weakness in knees and feet of the aged
late development of teeth in small children
over abundance of bleeding during menses
heat in blood with bleeding not during menses
dark purple pieces of blood during menses
English.Preparation: Internal use: 10 to 24 g in decoction. Suitable to roast in sand. If using raw shells, boil before other herbs. External use: char and retain property. Grind into powder and apply on affected area.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yangxu (yang deficient) or pixu (spleen deficient); not to use in cases of cold/flu infection not yet cleared; use with care during pregnancies; not to use in patients who are weak and without fever. The herb is cold and can reduce yang qi.
English.Research: Modern research indicates that the herb improves function of anti-cancer ability.
English.Notes: Gui ban jiao is more concentrated and stronger than gui ban. It is the gelatin obtained by prolonged cooking of tortoise shell.
Chemical Ingredients: inorganic ions: K+, Na+, Ca2+, Fe3+, P

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量：3 ~ 6 克
Chinese.Contraindications: 长期使用不适合那些阴虚、伴有严重疾病、舌红无苔、口干、偏爱冷饮的人。
Chinese.Notes: 这种有绿萼的品种叫做绿萼梅，字面意思是带绿萼的杏花。在经典的《本草纲目》中称为白花梅，字面意思是白花的梅。

Common: Japanese apricot flower with green calyx

Maladies Treated: Stomachache caused by dominant liver qi
English.Preparation: Daily dosage: 3 ~ 6 g
English.Contraindications: Long term usage are not suitable for those who are yinxu (yin deficient) with serious sickness, accompanied with red tongue without fur, dry mouth, and preferring cold drink.
English.Notes: The variety that has green calyx is called lu e mei, literally means apricot (flowers) with green calyx. In the classics Ben Cao Gang Mu it is called bai hua mei, literally means white flower plum.

Botanical: 糙葉敗醬 subsp. 糙葉

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：煎煮9到15克。外用：適量。捣碎后涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: [1] 中藥大辭典 [2] 中華本草
Chinese.Research: 毒性與注意事項: [1] 中藥大辭典 [2] 中華本草
Chinese.Notes: 現代研究表明該草藥含有多種化學成分。
Chemical Ingredients: 十氫-4,8,8-三甲基-9-亞甲基-1,4-嗎啡藍烯

English.Preparation: Oral: in decoction 9 to 15 g. External application: appropriate amount. Smash and apply.
English.Contraindications: [1] Zhong Yao Da Ci Dian [2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao
English.Research: Toxicity & Cautions: [1] Zhong Yao Da Ci Dian [2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao
English.Notes: Modern research indicates various chemical components present in the herb.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：10 - 30 毫升，煎煮、浸泡或与其他食物混合。外用：适量。漱口或与其他草药混合涂抹，或用于蒸汽或清洗。
Chinese.Contraindications: 如果湿气重、身体虚弱、肌肉萎缩或痉挛，或在感冒或流感早期，请谨慎使用。
Chinese.Research: 醋具有杀虫效果，通过醋酸的体外测试显示在前囊虫中迅速致死，并对各种病原体表现出抗菌和抗病毒效果。
Chinese.Notes: 前囊虫是绦虫属（Echinococcus）的幼虫形式。囊肿是由于感染某些绦虫Echinococcus种的幼虫而形成的囊肿。

English.Preparation: Oral: 10 - 30 ml in decoction, or soaking, or mix with other food items. External use: appropriate amount. Rinsing in the mouth, or mix with other herb and apply, or use in steaming or washing.
English.Contraindications: Use with care if dampness is heavy, the body is weak and muscles are in atrophy, or spastic, or during the early stage of cold or influenza.
English.Research: Vinegar has insecticidal effects, demonstrated through in vitro tests with acetic acid leading to rapid mortality in protoscolex and exhibits antibacterial and antiviral effects against various pathogens.
English.Notes: Protoscolex is the larval form of the tapeworm parasite of the genus Echinococcus. Hydatid is a cyst due to infection by larvae of some species of the tapeworm Echinococcus.

Chinese.Preparation: 典型剂量为每天6-10克，但对于高血压推荐超过30克。较小的剂量可能具有升压效果。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不应用于肝阳上亢型高血压、急性感染如感冒或流感、脓疮、皮肤溃疡、阴虚发热或消化道感染。有些品种有毒。少数情况下可能导致皮疹，尤其是在脾虚或肾阳虚的患者中。
Chinese.Research: 大剂量(超过35克)可以降低血压，具有血管扩张作用。小剂量(在15克以内)可以升高血压，延长利尿效果，减少蛋白尿，提高耐力，保护肝功能，调节血糖。黄芪苷IV具有很强的抗HBV活性。
Chinese.Notes: 较小的药材优于较大的；野生根被认为是最好的，因为其纤维独特。
Chemical Ingredients: L-3-羟基-9-甲氧基苯基银杏烷

English.Preparation: Typical dosage is 6-10 g daily, but above 30 g is recommended for hypertension. Smaller dosages can have a hypertensive effect.
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in liver yang ascending type of hypertension, acute infections like cold or flu, boils, skin ulcers, yin deficiency with fever, or digestive tract infections. Some varieties are toxic. Rare cases may cause skin rash, especially in patients with spleen deficiency or kidney yang deficiency.
English.Research: Large dosages (above 35 grams) can lower blood pressure with vaso-dilation effects. Small dosages (within 15 grams) can increase blood pressure, prolong diuretic effects, lessen proteinuria, improve endurance, protect liver function, and regulate blood sugar. Astragaloside IV has potent anti-HBV activity.
English.Notes: Smaller pieces of the herb are preferred over larger ones; wild roots are considered the best due to distinctive fibers.

Maladies Treated: 呕吐或打嗝伴有未消化食物
Chinese.Preparation: 花用于煎汤 3 至 5 克。外用：适量使用。根：1.5 克至 9 克，制成药丸或粉末形式。
Chinese.Contraindications: 球茎和花已知可以引起敏感人群的皮肤炎，尽管每天最多可以吃 5 个球茎而没有不良反应。如果吃得太多会导致某些人腹泻。
Chinese.Research: 叶子和茎的醇提取物对蜡样芽孢杆菌和真菌芽孢杆菌具有抑制作用。
Chinese.Notes: 毒性可能是一个问题；每天消费不超过 5 个球茎通常是安全的。
Chemical Ingredients: 槲皮素-3-O-β-金丝草苷-7-O-β-葡萄糖醛酸苷
槲皮素-3-O-β-山柰苷-7-O-β-葡萄糖醛酸苷

Maladies Treated: Vomiting or burping with undigested food
English.Preparation: Flowers for decoction 3 to 5 g. For external application: use appropriate amount. Root: 1.5 g to 9 g in pills or in powder form.
English.Contraindications: The bulb and the flowers have been known to cause dermatitis in sensitive people, though up to 5 bulbs a day can be eaten without ill effect. It can cause diarrhea in some people if eaten too much.
English.Research: Alcohol extract of leaves and stems possess inhibiting effect on Bacillus cereus and bacillus mycoides.
English.Notes: Toxicity can be an issue; it's generally safe to consume up to 5 bulbs a day.

Maladies Treated: 因肝肾虚弱所致的腰膝酸痛
因肝肾虚弱所致的类风湿关节炎
Chinese.Contraindications: 不应在排尿困难或阴虚火旺的情况下使用

Maladies Treated: achy loin and knees due to liver and kidney deficiency
rheumatoid arthritis due to liver and kidney deficiency
English.Preparation: 4.5 - 9 g in decoction.
English.Contraindications: not to use in cases of difficulty in urination or heat from yinxu (yin deficient)

Chinese.Preparation: 口服服用：9到18克煎汤。
Chinese.Research: 毒性与注意事项：未提供具体细节。
Chinese.Notes: 止痛、化热痰和止咳：与猪肉煮汤并口服。

English.Preparation: For oral consumption: 9 to 18 g in decoction.
English.Research: Toxicity & Cautions: specific details were not provided.
English.Notes: For arresting pain, getting rid of hot phlegm and cough: make soup with pork and take orally.

Chinese.Preparation: 烏梅用量：3到9克；綠萼梅用量：3到4.5克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在体内热过盛（高热伴感染）和滞留或未解决的外部疾病情况下，不要使用烏梅。与磺胺类药物一起使用烏梅可能导致尿道出血。
Chinese.Research: 待加载。
Chinese.Notes: 烏梅（黑梅）在快成熟时采摘并烘焙。白梅是用盐水腌制并干燥的未成熟梅子。綠萼梅是植物的花，具有绿色萼片。用途包括疏肝解郁、平胃、治疗癔症。

English.Preparation: Wu mei dosage: 3 to 9 g; Lu e mei dosage: 3 to 4.5 g.
English.Contraindications: Do not use wu mei in cases of internal heat excess (high fever with infection) and stagnation or unresolved exterior disorders. Using wu mei together with sulfonamides may cause bleeding in the urinary tract.
English.Research: To be loaded.
English.Notes: Wu mei (black prunes) are collected before they are almost ripe and baked. Bai mei (white prunes) are unripe plums pickled in salt water and dried. Lu e mei are the flowers of the plant with green calyx. Uses include dispersing liver stagnation, calming the stomach, and treating globus hystericus.

Chinese.Preparation: 9~15克煮水服用。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究总结为当前发现。

English.Preparation: 9~15 grams in decoction. Take orally.
English.Research: Modern research summarized as current findings.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：以煎湯或丸劑或粉末形式服用30-60克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 勿與酒精同用。
Chinese.Research: 三種蘑菇物種的水提取物，即Coprinellus sp.、Coprinus comatus和Flammulina velutipes被認定為新型抗乳腺癌劑。
Chinese.Notes: 用作炒菜的蔬菜，可以與其他蔬菜、肉類或湯同用。

English.Preparation: Taking orally: 30-60 g in decoction or in pills or powder form.
English.Contraindications: Do not use with alcohol.
English.Research: Water-based extracts of three mushroom species, Coprinellus sp., Coprinus comatus, Flammulina velutipes were identified as novel anti-breast cancer agents.
English.Notes: Use as vegetable in stir fry with other vegetables, with meat or soup.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：3到9克。外用：适量使用。磨成粉末，制成糊状涂抹在患处。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在消化能力弱的情况下谨慎使用。不得在没有血瘀的情况下使用，或者在脓肿已经成熟并化脓的情况下使用，或在妊娠期间使用。
Chinese.Research: Commiphora molmol的油胶树脂的石油醚提取物，以每公斤体重500毫克的剂量，对卡拉胶诱导的炎症和棉球肉芽肿产生显著抑制作用。该提取物在小鼠中也显示出显著的退烧活性。
Chinese.Notes: 没药常与其他草药配合使用，以增强其疗效。

English.Preparation: For decoction: 3 to 9 g. For external use: use appropriate amount. Grind into powder and make into paste and apply to affected areas.
English.Contraindications: Use with care in cases of weak digestion. Not to use where there is no blood stasis, or in cases of where boils have ripened and ulcerated or in cases of pregnancies.
English.Research: The petroleum ether extract of the oleo-gum resin of Commiphora molmol, at a dose of 500 mg/kg body weight, produced significant inhibition of carrageenan induced inflammation and cotton pellet granuloma. The extract also showed significant antipyretic activity in mice.
English.Notes: Myrrh is often used in combinations with other herbs to enhance its efficacy.

Chinese.Preparation: 对于便秘或轻度肠梗阻，将12克皂角刺和12克细辛混合成粉末，再加入120克蜂蜜制成栓剂，温热时放入肛门内。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不可过量使用。大量使用可能引起呕吐和腹泻。孕期、气虚或阴虚、咯血的情况下不宜使用。
Chinese.Notes: 皂角刺的过去替代品包括刺枣、国槐、蔷薇等植物的刺枝。

English.Preparation: For constipation or mild intestine obstruction, mix 12 g of zao jiao ci and 12 g of xi xin into powder with 120 g honey to make a suppository, insert into anus while warm.
English.Contraindications: Do not overdose. Large amounts can induce vomiting and diarrhea. Do not use during pregnancy or in cases of qi deficiency or yin deficiency, or hemoptysis.
English.Notes: Past substitutes for zao jiao ci include branches with thorns of Ziziphus jujuba, Sophora japonica, Rosa multiflora, among others.

Chinese.Preparation: 通常不用于煎剂。用于丸剂或粉末形式。成人: 1.5～5克（炒熟的种子）。外用: 使用适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 成人的估计致死剂量为1毫克/公斤；两到四颗种子可能导致成人严重中毒，八颗通常致命。如果种子未咀嚼而吞下，中毒的可能性较小。儿童: 一到三颗种子可能致命。中毒反应: 严重的胃肠炎和急性脱水。已报道肾功能和肝功能不全。

Maladies Treated: tuberculosis of lymph nodes of the neck
English.Preparation: Usually not used in decoction. Being used in pills or powder form. For adult: 1.5～5g (stir fried semen). External application: use appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: The estimated lethal dose in man is 1 mg/kg; two to four seeds may cause severe poisoning in an adult, and 8 are generally fatal. If seeds are swallowed without chewing, poisoning is unlikely. Children: One to three seeds can be fatal. Poisoning reaction: intense gastroenteritis and acute dehydration. Renal and hepatic insufficiency have been reported.

Maladies Treated: 冠状动脉动脉粥样硬化
抑制β-淀粉样蛋白的积累
Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量：3 ~ 9克
Chinese.Contraindications: 长期大量服用可能刺激胃黏膜并导致溃疡。如果血虚且没有气滞和血瘀，则禁忌。
Chinese.Research: 姜黄素抑制慢性淋巴细胞白血病B细胞中的生存途径，并与绿茶提取物表没食子酸没食子茶（EGCG）联合使用可能克服其基质保护。与对照组相比，姜黄处理动物的白细胞和红细胞水平显著下降。
Chinese.Notes: 参见鉴别姜黄、郁金、树菊姜黄和额竹。

English.Preparation: Daily dosage: 3 ~ 9 g
English.Contraindications: Prolonged large dosage may irritate the mucus of the stomach and cause ulcer. Contra-indication if blood deficient but without qi stagnation and blood stasis.
English.Research: Curcumin inhibits prosurvival pathways in chronic lymphocytic leukemia B cells and combined with green tea extract epigallocatechin-3 gallate (EGCG) may overcome their stromal protection. Significant fall in the WBC and RBC levels of Curcuma longa treated animals compared to controls.
English.Notes: See the differentiating jiang huang, yu jin, shu gu jiang huang and e zhu.

Maladies Treated: 寒冷疼痛的下背部和膝盖
Chinese.Preparation: 使用6-15克草药。通常浸泡在酒中以增强对肾阳虚的效果。传统上用山羊脂肪翻炒制备。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚火旺患者禁用。长期以煎剂服用可能损伤阴液。可能的副作用包括头晕、呕吐、口干、口渴和鼻出血。
Chinese.Research: 研究表明它改善内分泌系统、DNA代谢、免疫系统，并具有抗衰老特性。它还促进血液循环并防止血小板凝聚。
Chinese.Notes: 在传统中医中常用于各种疾病，包括阳痿和更年期症状。
Chemical Ingredients: 去水淫羊藿苷-3-O-α-鼠李糖苷

Maladies Treated: Painful cold lower back and knees
English.Preparation: 6-15 g of the herb is used. Often steeped in wine for effects on kidney yang deficiency. Traditionally prepared by stir frying with goat fat.
English.Contraindications: Contraindicated in patients with fire from yin deficiency. It should not be taken as a decoction for prolonged periods as it can damage the yin. Possible side effects include dizziness, vomiting, dry mouth, thirst, and nose bleeding.
English.Research: Research indicates that it improves the endocrine system, DNA metabolism, immune system, and has anti-aging properties. It also promotes blood flow and prevents platelet coagulation.
English.Notes: Often used in traditional Chinese medicine for various ailments including impotence and menopausal symptoms.

Chinese.Preparation: 阿胶在空腹时服用（至少在餐前一小时或餐后三小时）。对于慢性溃疡性结肠炎，阿胶在热水中软化，切成小片并通过肛管递送。对于失眠，它与其他草药配方一起使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 有血瘀、消化弱或外感如感冒或流感时，不得使用。腹泻情况下禁用。
Chinese.Research: 阿胶改善红细胞计数，矫正低血压，提高实验鼠的抗压能力，加强营养不良的豚鼠的肌肉力量，改善实验犬的钙吸收，增强免疫系统，帮助肾脏炎症。
Chinese.Notes: 阿胶在使用前应浸泡在米酒中以去除腥味。它常与香蒲花粉联合使用以增强其治疗效果。

Maladies Treated: Bleeding in the uterus not during menses
English.Preparation: E jiao is taken on an empty stomach (at least one hour before or three hours after a meal). For chronic ulcerative colitis, e jiao is softened in hot water, cut into pieces and delivered via anus tube. For insomnia, it is used in a formula with other herbs.
English.Contraindications: Do not use when there is blood stasis, weak digestion, or external syndrome such as cold or flu. It is contraindicated in cases of diarrhea.
English.Research: E jiao improves red cell count, corrects hypotension, increases stress resistance in laboratory mice, enhances muscle strength in malnourished guinea pigs, improves calcium absorption in laboratory dogs, boosts immune system, and aids kidney inflammation.
English.Notes: E jiao should be soaked in rice wine to rid of gamey smell before use. It is commonly combined with cattail pollen for its therapeutic effects.

Chinese.Preparation: 煎剂：10到15克。使用鲜草时加倍。不要过度煮沸。外用：适量使用。捣碎后涂抹于受影响区域。
Chinese.Contraindications: 使用炭制剂时要小心，因为其止血效果可能更强。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明，小薊能有效止血，并对多种细菌有抑制作用。
Chinese.Notes: 炭化后，其止血效果更强。

Maladies Treated: Infection of urinary tract with bleeding
English.Preparation: For decoction: 10 to 15 g. Double the amount if using fresh herb. Do not over cook. External application: use appropriate amount. Smash and apply to affected areas.
English.Contraindications: Use caution when using the charcoal preparation, as it can be stronger in its properties to arrest bleeding.
English.Research: Modern studies indicate that xiao ji can effectively arrest bleeding and has inhibitory effects on various bacteria.
English.Notes: After being charred, the property of arresting bleeding is stronger.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：煎剂9到15克。外用：使用适量。捣碎后敷用或用煎剂洗涤。
Chinese.Contraindications: 黄水茄是有毒的。过量可导致口干、口渴、吞咽困难、发热、皮肤干燥、发红、瞳孔扩大、视力模糊等症状。如果中毒严重，可导致呼吸、循环抑制，甚至呼吸衰竭，导致死亡。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明与过量相关的毒性和警示。
Chinese.Notes: N/A
Chemical Ingredients: 3β-苯氧基-14β，22ξ-二羟基-4α-甲基-24ξ-乙基-5α-胆甾-7烯-6-酮
3β-苯氧基-14α，22ξ-二羟基-4α-甲基-24ξ-乙基-5α-胆甾-7烯-6-酮
诺卡普酯，22-羟基-6-氧-4-甲基-24-甲基胆甾-7-烯-苯甲酸酯

English.Preparation: Oral: for decoction 9 to 15 g. External application: use appropriate amount. Smash and apply or wash with decoction.
English.Contraindications: Huang shui qie is toxic. Overdose can cause dry mouth, thirst, difficulty in swallowing, fever, dry skin, redness, dilated pupils, blurry vision and other symptoms. If poisoning is severe, it can cause respiratory, circulatory inhibition and even respiratory failure and result in death.
English.Research: Modern research indicates toxicity and cautions related to overdose.
English.Notes: N/A

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：煎剂，15 ~ 30克，或新鲜药材60 ~ 120克；或制成粉末或榨汁，混合蜂蜜口服或漱口。外用：适量，洗净，捣碎外敷或煎剂；或日晾制成粉末作为膏状物外用；或制成外用乳霜或面霜涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 欧洲食品安全局的饮食产品、营养和过敏小组认为，Morinda citrifolia（诺丽）果泥和浓缩液在指定条件下作为新型食品成分对一般人群是安全的。然而，有报告显示某些个体对肝毒性效果的敏感性，美国FDA将其列为有毒物质。
Chinese.Research: 体外测试表明，诺丽叶的乙醇提取物对消灭人类蛔虫有良好效果。诺丽果汁在急性肝损伤中具有保护作用。诺丽果汁提高小鼠体内干扰素γ水平，表明具有免疫调节效应。
Chinese.Notes: 现代研究表明其对肝脏健康的潜在影响，并对肾功能障碍或消费诺丽产品的人群提出警告。
Chemical Ingredients: 1,6-二羟基-5-甲氧基-2-甲氧基甲基蒽醌
1,5,7-三羟基-6-甲氧基-2-甲氧基甲基蒽醌

English.Preparation: Oral consumption: decoction, 15 ~ 30 g, or fresh herb 60 ~ 120 g; or make into the powder or make into juice and mix with honey for oral consumption or for gargling. External use: appropriate amount, washed, smashed apply topically or with decoction; or sun dry and make into powder and apply as paste; or make into topical creams, or face cream and apply.
English.Contraindications: The Panel on Dietetic Products, Nutrition and Allergies of European Food Safety Authority concludes that Morinda citrifolia (Noni) fruit puree and concentrate as novel food ingredients under the specified conditions are considered safe for the general population. However, there are reported sensitivities for hepatotoxic effects in some individuals and it is listed by the U.S. FDA as toxic.
English.Research: In vitro tests show that the ethanol extract of noni leaves has a good effect in getting rid of human roundworm. Noni fruit juice has a protective role in acute liver damage. Noni fruit juice increases interferone γ levels in mice, indicating immunomodulatory effects.
English.Notes: Modern research indicates potential effects on liver health and raises caution for those with renal dysfunction or those consuming noni products.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：煎劑 9 - 15 克或浸泡在米酒中。外用：使用適量，捣碎或制成液體外用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 懷孕期間需小心使用。
Chinese.Research: 現代研究突顯其潛在的藥用功能和治療應用，但對其毒性須保持謹慎。
Chinese.Notes: 信息來源於《中華本草》和《南寧市藥物志》。

Maladies Treated: pain and swelling from impact injuries
English.Preparation: Taking orally: in decoction 9 - 15 g or soak in rice wine. External use: use appropriate amount. Smash or make into liquid and apply.
English.Contraindications: Use with care during pregnancy.
English.Research: Modern research highlights the potential medicinal functions and therapeutic applications, but caution is advised regarding toxicity.
English.Notes: Information sourced from《中華本草》 and《南寧市藥物志》.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服，煎剂：6到12克。鲜草：30到60克。外用：适量捣碎后涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 可能对肾脏和睾丸产生不良影响。
Chinese.Research: 保肝作用：抑制HBV复制，抗病毒，抗炎。

English.Preparation: For oral consumption, in decoction: 6 to 12 g. Fresh herb: 30 to 60 g. External application: use appropriate amount, smash and apply.
English.Contraindications: May have deleterious effect on kidney and testes.
English.Research: Hepatoprotective effect: inhibits HBV replication, anti-virus, anti-inflammatory.

Maladies Treated: 孕妇巨细胞病毒 (CMV) 感染
因性功能弱而导致的怀孕困难
Chinese.Preparation: 内服：3到9克煎煮。外用：根据需要用煎剂洗涤或制成粉末，作为膏药使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在肾阴虚、肝火上升或阴茎勃起异常的情况下不得使用。一些传统文献指出它与牡丹皮、巴豆和贝母有相克作用。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明蛇床子具有多种药理作用，包括心血管和中枢神经系统的活性，以及在阳痿和免疫功能相关问题上的潜在应用。
Chinese.Notes: 蛇床子被认为对肾脏有益，且与改善男性性健康和增强免疫反应有关联。

Maladies Treated: Impotence due to kidney yang deficiency
Difficulty in conceiving due to weak sexual function
English.Preparation: Internal use: 3 to 9 g in decoction. External use: use accordingly for washing with decoction or make into powder and use as paste.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of kidney yin deficiency, liver fire ascending with/or priapism. Some traditional sources state it antagonizes mu dan pi, ba dou, and bei mu.
English.Research: Modern research indicates that Cnidium monnieri has various pharmacological effects, including cardiovascular and central nervous system activities, as well as potential applications for issues related to impotence and immune function.
English.Notes: Cnidium monnieri is recognized for its effects on the kidney and has been linked to improving male sexual health and enhancing immune response.

Maladies Treated: 感冒或流感引起的发热和头痛
Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量10至30克。用于感冒或流感治疗：将15克葱白与生姜和豆豉等其他材料煮沸，趁温饮用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在表虚（表证虚）伴有盗汗的情况下不宜使用。

Maladies Treated: common cold or influenza with fever and headache
English.Preparation: Daily dosage of 10 to 30 g. For treatment of common cold or flu: boil 15 g of cong bai with other ingredients like gan jiang and dou chi, drink while warm.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in cases of biao xu (external deficient) with instant sweating.

Maladies Treated: 月经以外的阴道大量出血
Chinese.Preparation: 煎服：4至12克。外用：适量。
Chinese.Contraindications: 体质虚弱且偏冷者不宜使用。

Maladies Treated: Excessive bleeding of the vagina not during menses
Ulcer and pain of the skin
English.Preparation: For use in decoction: 4 to 12 g. For external use: appropriate amount.
English.Contraindications: Those with weak and cold type of bodies should not use.

Chinese.Preparation: 6 ~ 15 克，煎汤服用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 怀孕期间或出血过多时不宜使用。注意：在烘烤前不要将此药草浸泡在水中。
Chinese.Research: 细叶石松中的成分α-伸筋草碱具有抑制乙酰胆碱酯酶的作用，可以作为治疗脾虚引起的痴呆的药草。具有消炎作用，降压作用，抑制白色念珠菌分泌天冬氨酸酶。
Chinese.Notes: 需要注意的是，这种药草有时被称为舒筋藤，但不要与主要被称为舒筋藤的天冬藤混淆。

English.Preparation: 6 ~ 15 g in decoction.
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancies or during excessive bleeding. Note: do not presoak this herb in water before baking.
English.Research: The ingredient α-onocerin of Lycopodium clavatum has the effect of inhibiting acetylcholinesterase and can be an herb for treating dementia caused by spleen deficiency. Anti-inflammatory effect, hypotensive effect, inhibiting Candida Albicans secreted aspartic proteases.
English.Notes: It is important to note that this herb is sometimes called kuan jin teng but not to confuse with Herba Tinosporae sinensis which is mainly called kuan jin teng.

Chinese.Contraindications: 注意：八大肝是一个传统蒙古医学术语，其特征是过多的痰、恶心、呕吐、消化不良、食欲不振、腹痛和胀满、腿部和背部疼痛、嗜睡、白带和肥胖。
Chinese.Notes: 这种草药在蒙古民族医学中用于各种消化和生殖问题。

English.Preparation: Dosage: 0.6 – 1.8 g.
English.Contraindications: Note: Ba da gan is a traditional Mongolian medicine term characterized by excessive phlegm, nausea, vomiting, poor digestion, lack of appetite, abdominal pain and fullness, leg and back pain, sleepiness, leucorrhea, and obesity.
English.Notes: The herb is used in Mongolian ethnic medicine for various digestive and reproductive issues.

Chinese.Preparation: 阿拉伯膠主要用於食品行業，作為穩定劑和乳化劑。它可溶於冷水，加熱會增加它的溶解度。
Chinese.Notes: 阿拉伯膠可以溶解於濃度低於15%的酒精溶液中，並且與水的混合比例可達到60%。

English.Preparation: Gum Arabic is primarily used in the food industry as a stabilizer and emulsifier. It is soluble in cold water, and heating increases its solubility.
Properties: Not soluble in oil or alcohol
English.Notes: Gum Arabic can dissolve in alcohol solutions with less than 15% concentration and can have a mixing ratio of up to 60% with water.

Botanical: 英国旋覆花 (Inula britannica L.var. chinensis)

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量为 3 到 9 克，包裹在布中以制成 decoction。
Chinese.Contraindications: 不适用于阴虚伴有慢性咳嗽、风热型干咳。
Chinese.Research: 旋覆花提取物的抗炎活性可能归因于通过抑制IκBα和MAP激酶磷酸化而下调NF-κB活化，从而抑制NO、iNOS和细胞因子的表达。
Chinese.Notes: 含有多种化学成分，如菊糖和倍半萜内酯。

Maladies Treated: Asthmatic cough with abundance of phlegm
English.Preparation: Daily dosage of 3 to 9 g, wrapped in cloth to make decoction.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in yinxu (yin deficient) with chronic cough, dry cough with wind heat type syndrome.
English.Research: Anti-inflammatory activities of xuan fu hua extract might be attributed to the inhibition of NO, iNOS and cytokine expression through the down-regulation of NF-κB activation via suppression of IκBα and MAP kinase phosphorylation in macrophages.
English.Notes: Contains various chemical components such as inulicin and sesquiterpene lactones.

Chinese.Preparation: 正常用法为 5 至 10 克，大剂量可达 30 克。用水煮沸制作茶或煎剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 阴虚肝阳上亢者及因湿热而导致尿困难者禁止使用。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明商业样本中可能存在农药残留，建议在使用前彻底清洗草药。
Chinese.Notes: 由于可能存在农业化学品残留，使用时需谨慎。

English.Preparation: Normal usage is 5 to 10 g. Large dosage can be up to 30 g. Boil with water to make tea or decoction.
English.Contraindications: Not to use in cases of liver yang ascending and in cases of difficulty in urination due to damp-heat.
English.Research: Modern research indicates potential exposure to farm chemical residues in commercial samples. It is suggested to wash the herb thoroughly before use.
English.Notes: Caution is advised due to potential agricultural chemical residues.

Chinese.Preparation: 内服：煎剂，10-15克。外用：适量，粉末外敷。
Chinese.Contraindications: 出血和淤血情况下不宜单独使用。

Common: leaf sheath fibres of fortune windmill palm

English.Preparation: Internal use: Decoction, 10-15g. External use: Appropriate amount, powdered for external application.
English.Contraindications: Not suitable for use alone in cases of bleeding and stagnation.

Chinese.Preparation: 3-9克用作粉末或煎剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 毒性剂量为30至60克。可能引起如皮疹、荨麻疹等过敏反应，伴随发热。
Chinese.Research: 在一种先进的牙周病动物模型中发现的毒蝎毒素抑制了骨质流失。Kalitoxin可能有助于治疗与骨质流失相关的牙周疾病。
Chinese.Notes: 含有多种神经毒素和其他生物活性肽，对许多医疗功能有用。
Chemical Ingredients: 具有抗癫痫特性的多肽

English.Preparation: 3-9g used as a powder or decoction.
English.Contraindications: Toxic dosage is 30 to 60 g. Can cause allergic reactions such as rash, urticaria, accompanied by fever.
English.Research: A compound found in scorpion venom has inhibited bone loss in an animal model of advanced periodontal disease. Kalitoxin may help treat periodontal disease related to bone loss.
English.Notes: Contains various neurotoxins and other bioactive peptides, useful in numerous medical functions.

Chinese.Preparation: 每日内服30至60克。外用没有固定用量，需酌情使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 该草药在以前的草药词典中未被记录，公开来源于河南省淇县的民间医学。由于可能不被广泛认可，使用时需谨慎。
Chinese.Research: Rubescensine A和B抑制癌细胞DNA和蛋白质的合成，并在实验动物中对Ehrlich-Ascites肿瘤、肉瘤180和食道癌展现了疗效。它们还可以缓解由乙酰胆碱引起的食道痉挛。
Chinese.Notes: 该草药在1977年被列入《中华民国医学词典》，并未在早期朝代中被认可。

Maladies Treated: Chronic inflammation of the pelvic area
English.Preparation: 30 to 60 g per day for internal use. No established amount for external use. Use accordingly.
Geography: Areas south of Yellow River Valley
English.Contraindications: This herb has not been recorded in previous herbal dictionaries and was made public from folk medicine in Qi, Henan province. Caution is advised as it may not be recognized universally.
English.Research: Rubescensine A and B inhibit the synthesis of DNA and protein of cancer cells and have demonstrated efficacy against Ehrlich-Ascites tumors, sarcoma180, and esophageal carcinoma in laboratory animals. They also relieve esophagismus induced by acetylcholine.
English.Notes: The herb was listed in the Medical Dictionary of the Republic of China in 1977 and was not previously recognized in earlier dynasties.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服，煎剂 3 至 9 克。外用：适量使用。研磨成粉制成膏药涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 火旺阴虚、便秘或有痔疮者应谨慎使用。此药与抗凝药物同服可能增加出血风险。使用抗血小板药物和非甾体抗炎药时应谨慎。此药可能降低血糖水平；服用糖尿病药物的患者需监测。可能与麻醉止痛药及其他药物相互作用。
Chinese.Research: 一项研究显示，种子的精油含有3.8%的挥发油，主要成分包括香豆素、香豆醇、γ-蒎烯、藏红花醛、对甲基苯乙烯和β-松油烯。
Chinese.Notes: 孜然可能会降低胆固醇水平；在使用其他降胆固醇药物时建议谨慎。

English.Preparation: Taking orally, in decoction 3 to 9 g. External application: use appropriate amount. Grind into powder to make into paste and apply.
English.Contraindications: Those who are yinxu with fire or those with constipation or with hemorrhoids should use with care. This herb may increase the risk of bleeding when taken with blood thinning drugs. Use with caution when using anti-platelet drugs and NSAIDs. This herb may reduce blood sugar levels; monitoring is necessary for patients taking diabetes medications. May interact with narcotic pain relievers and other medications.
English.Research: In one study, the essential oil of the seeds contained 3.8% volatile oil, with major components including cuminal, cuminic alcohol, γ-terpinene, safranal, p-cymene, and β-pinene.
English.Notes: Cumin may lower cholesterol levels; caution is advised when using other cholesterol-lowering medications.

Chinese.Contraindications: 在气虚或脾虚的血虚情况下使用时要小心。孕期或月经期间过度出血时不宜使用。
Chinese.Research: 请查看其他网站上的记忆改善研究。
Chinese.Notes: 请查看区分的姜黄、郁金、树菊姜黄和莪术。

Maladies Treated: Cancer of the neck of uterus
English.Preparation: Dosage: 3-10g.
English.Contraindications: Use care in cases of blood deficient with qi deficient or spleen deficient. Not to be used in cases of pregnancy or excessive bleeding during menses.
English.Research: See on memory improvement in another site.
English.Notes: See the differentiating jiang huang, yu jin, shu gu jiang huang and e zhu.

Maladies Treated: 慢性肺部疾病伴隨痰液
Chinese.Preparation: 新鮮生薑：每天3~8克，可用於煎湯。乾薑：每天1~3克，使用粉末形式。生薑皮：每天3~10克，可用於煎湯。
Chinese.Contraindications: 如有陰虛或胃熱伴隨嘔吐者，勿使用。
Chinese.Research: 生薑在加工和儲存後姜辣素會降低。姜的活性成分—薑烯，能顯著阻止腸毒素與細胞表面受體GM1的結合，從而防止腹瀉。

English.Preparation: Fresh ginger: 3 ~ 8 grams per day in decoction. Dry ginger: 1 ~ 3 grams per day, in powder form. Fresh ginger skin: 3 ~ 10 grams per day in decoction.
English.Contraindications: Do not use in case of yinxu (yin deficient) or in stomach heat with vomiting.
English.Research: Gingerol decreases after processing and storage of ginger. An active ingredient of ginger, zingerone, can significantly block the binding of enterotoxin to cell-surface receptor GM1, preventing diarrhea.

Botanical: 毛羌活 Notopterygium incisum Ting ex HT Chang
福尔斯羌活 Notopterygium forbesii Boiss.

Chinese.Preparation: 3到10克的煎剂。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在有麻木和疼痛伴随血虚或阴虚的情况下不宜服用。过量可能会导致恶心和呕吐。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究表明其潜在的抗生素特性及改善营养血液循环的能力。
Chinese.Notes: 用于驱风止痛，适用于各种疼痛和痉挛。

Botanical: Notopterygium incisum Ting ex HT Chang

English.Preparation: 3 to 10 g in decoction.
English.Contraindications: Not to take in cases of numbness and pain with xue xu blood deficient or with yinxu (yin deficient). Overdose may cause nausea and vomiting.
English.Research: Modern research indicates potential antibiotic properties and improvements in nutritional blood circulation.
English.Notes: Used for eliminating wind and alleviating pain, suitable for various pains and spasms.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服煎剂：10-15克，或加入丸剂或乳膏。
Chinese.Contraindications: 毒性与注意事项：未提供具体禁忌。
Chinese.Research: 现代研究：未记录具体发现。
Chinese.Notes: 处方示例包括用于治疗咳嗽和呼吸问题的各种组合。

English.Preparation: Take orally in decoction: 10-15 g; or add to pill or to cream.
English.Contraindications: Toxicity & Cautions: No specific contraindications provided.
English.Research: Modern Research: No specific findings noted.
English.Notes: Examples of prescriptions include various combinations for treating conditions like cough and breath issues.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服煎剂：9到15克。
Chinese.Contraindications: 含有高水平的草酸。不要过量，特别是肾脏问题、高血压或糖尿病患者。
Chinese.Research: 与摄入高水平草酸相关的毒性和注意事项。
Chinese.Notes: 对金黄色葡萄球菌具有自然抗生素效果。

English.Preparation: Take orally as decoction: 9 to 15 g.
English.Contraindications: It contains high level of oxalic acid. Do not overdose, especially those with kidney problems or with hypertension or with diabetes.
English.Research: Toxicity & cautions associated with the consumption of high levels of oxalic acid.
English.Notes: Contains natural antibiotic effects against Staphylococcus aureus.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：0.15克至0.3克。外用：製成粉末或膏狀並塗抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕婦禁用，氣虛或血虛患者禁用。
Chinese.Research: 0.5%的冰片溶液可以抑制細菌並具有保鮮效果。它抑制金黃色葡萄球菌、肺炎鏈球菌和大腸桿菌。並且具有鎮靜效應，促進孕鼠分娩。
Chinese.Notes: 常用於丸劑；很少用於煎劑。外用可用於洗滌或添加在外用藥物中。

Maladies Treated: Fainting due to strokes or heat
English.Preparation: Taking orally: 0.15 g to 0.3 g. External application: make into powder or paste and apply.
English.Contraindications: Do not use during pregnancy or on patients with qi deficient or blood deficient.
English.Research: 0.5% bing pian solution can inhibit bacteria and have preservation effect. It inhibits Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus pneumoniae, and Escherichia coli. It also has sedative effects and promotes delivery in pregnant mice.
English.Notes: Popularly used in pills; seldom in decoction. External application for washing or added in external medication.

Chinese.Preparation: 内服：3到9克；外用：研磨成粉，涂抹于患处。
Chinese.Contraindications: 孕期禁用，或在阴虚伴热、脾虚状态下禁用，或在感冒期间禁用。长期使用可能对肾脏有毒。
Chinese.Research: 海龙的水煎剂可以促进外周淋巴细胞转化并抑制人类癌细胞。剂量越大，癌细胞溶解率越高。海龙还显示出对免疫系统的显著影响，增加了小鼠胸腺重量和白细胞计数。
Chinese.Notes: 可引起子宫兴奋，增强收缩频率。

English.Preparation: For internal use: 3 to 9 g; for external use: grind into powder and apply to affected areas.
Geography: Southern part of China along the coast
English.Contraindications: Not to use during pregnancy, or in yinxu (yin deficient) with heat, in pixu (spleen deficient) condition, or during colds. Long term usage can be toxic to the kidney.
English.Research: Water decoction of hai long can promote peripheral lymphocyte transformation and inhibit human cancer cells. The larger the dosage the larger was the rate of dissolving of the cancer cells. Sea dragon also shows a significant effect on the immune system by increasing mouse thymus weight and white blood cell count.
English.Notes: Can induce uterine excitability with enhanced contraction and frequency.

Botanical: 满洲白桦 Betula mandshurica Nakai
垂狗儿白桦 Betula pendula Roth

Chinese.Preparation: 每日剂量：9至15克，制成粉末与液体混合口服。外用：适量。治疗痢疾：将樺樹皮煅烧成炭，磨成细粉。每次服用3克，每天两次。治疗尿少且热：用樺樹皮制成浓汤。
Chinese.Contraindications: 植物可能导致全身性毒性，范围从轻微的腹部痉挛到严重的心脏并发症。糖会引起腹泻，腹泻时不应使用。
Chinese.Research: 白桦醇可以抑制胆固醇和甘油三酯的合成，有效预防肥胖、动脉硬化和二型糖尿病。它还具有止咳、祛痰和抗哮喘的效果。

English.Preparation: Daily dosage: 9 to 15 g, make into powder mix with liquid. Take orally. External use: appropriate amount. For treatment of dysentery: calcine hua shu pi into charcoal, grind into fine powder. Take 3 g each time, twice a day. For treatment of hot and small amount of urine: use hua shu pi to make into strong decoction.
English.Contraindications: Plants can cause systemic toxicity varying from mild abdominal cramping to serious cardiac complications. Sugar can induce diarrhea and should not be used in case of diarrhea.
English.Research: Betulin can inhibit the synthesis of cholesterol and triglycerides, effectively preventing obesity, atherosclerosis, and type II diabetes. It also has anti-cough, expectorant, and anti-asthmatic effects.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服用，煎服：3 - 6 克。外用：適量使用，捣碎后涂抹。
Chinese.Contraindications: 整株植物有毒，可以损害牙齿并导致牙齿脱落。
Chinese.Research: 抗肿瘤活性成分为聚合物。0.25g/kg的酒精提取物口服或腹腔注射显示对小鼠白血病L615的抑制率为28.5%。

English.Preparation: For oral consumption, in decoction: 3 - 6 g. For external use: use appropriate amount. Smash and apply.
English.Contraindications: The whole plant is toxic. It can damage the teeth and can cause the teeth to fall off.
English.Research: The anti-tumor active ingredient is a polymer. Usage of the alcohol extract of 0.25g/kg for oral or intraperitoneal injection showed an inhibition of murine leukemia L615 with an inhibition rate of 28.5%.

Chinese.Contraindications: 此药材毒性较低，但过量可能导致腹泻。不宜在阳虚或因脾虚引起的腹泻情况下使用。过长时间的烹饪可能因油分蒸发而降低药效。
Chinese.Research: 五味子、女贞子、银耳、山药的组合可以抑制自由基，减缓实验动物的衰老。
Chinese.Notes: 长时间烹饪可能会减少药效。

English.Contraindications: This herb has low toxicity but overdose can cause diarrhea. Not to be used in cases of yang deficiency, or diarrhea due to spleen deficiency. Over cooking may lessen the effectiveness due to evaporating oil.
English.Research: A combination of wu wei zi, nu zhen zi, yin er, shan yao can inhibit free radicals and slow aging in lab animals.
English.Notes: The effectiveness may be reduced with prolonged cooking.

Maladies Treated: 腰膝酸軟 (Lassitude of the loins and knees)
大型B細胞淋巴瘤 (Large B cell lymphoma)
Chinese.Preparation: 每日煎煮 3-10 克於水中。
Chinese.Contraindications: 對於處於外感疾病初期的患者禁用。對於有腎結石、糖尿病或高血壓的患者，因草酸不宜大量或長期使用。應多喝水以防止草酸鈣形成。
Chinese.Research: 在抑制乙型肝炎病毒複製、導致白血病、淋巴瘤和多發性骨髓瘤細胞凋亡方面的效果，抗炎和抗氧化作用，免疫調節活性，促進線粒體能量產生，並保護多巴胺能神經元退化。
Chinese.Notes: 現代研究顯示其對乙型肝炎病毒的作用。

Maladies Treated: Lassitude of the loins and knees
English.Preparation: 3-10 g daily decocted in water.
English.Contraindications: It is contraindicated in patients at the onset of the exopathic diseases. Not to use in large amount or long term usage in patients with kidney stones, or with diabetes or hypertension because of oxalic acid. Drink large amount of water to prevent forming of oxalate.
English.Research: Effects of inhibiting replicating of hepatitis B virus, causing apoptosis in leukemia, lymphoma, and multiple myeloma cells, anti-inflammatory and antioxidation effects, immunomodulatory activity, promotes mitochondrial energy production, and protects dopaminergic neuron degeneration.
English.Notes: Modern research indicates effects on hepatitis B virus.

Chinese.Preparation: 作为利尿剂以低剂量使用。
Chinese.Contraindications: 在世界某些地方及美国某些州，这种草药是非法的。
Chinese.Research: 迷幻鼠尾草含有高选择性κ-阿片受体激动剂salvinorin A，产生视觉幻觉和联觉。它是正在流行的精神活性膳食补充剂的一部分。
Chinese.Notes: Mazatec萨满使用它进行精神治疗。

English.Preparation: Used at low dosage as a diuretic.
English.Contraindications: This herb is not legal in some parts of the world and also in some states in the U.S.
English.Research: Salvia divinorum contains the highly selective kappa-opioid receptor agonist salvinorin A, which produces visual hallucinations and synesthesia. It is part of a trend in psychoactive dietary supplements that are gaining popularity.
English.Notes: Mazatec shamans use it for spiritual healing.

Chinese.Preparation: 口服：使用50-200毫克与温开水一起服用。对于儿童，使用1%蜂皇浆蜂蜜，剂量根据年龄而异（4岁以下5克，5-10岁10克，10岁以上20克）。
Chinese.Contraindications: 感染引起的腹泻不能使用。孕期或哺乳期使用时应谨慎。
Chinese.Research: 蜂皇浆含有胰岛素样肽，具有抗氧化特性。它可以降低血糖、血脂，并具有抗菌和抗炎效果。
Chinese.Notes: 蜂皇浆的抗菌效果在pH值为4.5时最强，高pH值时效能减弱。其化学成分包括水分、蛋白质、脂肪和维生素。

English.Preparation: To take orally: use 50-200 mg with lukewarm boiled water. For children, 1% royal jelly honey is used, dosage varies by age (5g for under 4 years, 10g for 5-10 years, and 20g for over 10 years).
English.Contraindications: Not to be used in cases of diarrhea due to infection. Use with caution while pregnant or breastfeeding.
English.Research: Royal jelly contains insulin-like peptides and has antioxidant properties. It can lower blood sugar, blood lipids, and has antibacterial and anti-inflammatory effects.
English.Notes: Royal jelly's antibacterial effect is strongest at a pH of 4.5 and diminishes at higher pH levels. Its chemical composition includes moisture, proteins, fats, and vitamins.

Maladies Treated: 因寒湿宫虚引起的阴道念珠菌感染
Chinese.Preparation: 9到21克
Chinese.Contraindications: 脾虚引起的腹泻患者不宜使用。不适合出现热象的患者使用。
